A small number of children appear to develop normally in the first year, and then go through a period of regression between 18 and 24 months of age when they develop autism symptoms.While there is no cure for autism spectrum disorder, intensive, early treatment can make a big difference in the lives of many children.

title: 自身免疫性肝炎
desc: 自身免疫性肝炎是当您身体的免疫系统对抗肝细胞时发生的肝脏炎症。自身免疫性肝炎的确切原因尚不清楚，但遗传和环境因素似乎随着时间的推移相互作用而引发该疾病。未经治疗的自身免疫性肝炎可导致肝脏疤痕（肝硬化）并最终导致肝衰竭。然而，如果及早诊断和治疗，自身免疫性肝炎通常可以通过抑制免疫系统的药物来控制。当自身免疫性肝炎对药物治疗没有反应或患有晚期肝病时，肝移植可能是一种选择。
desc_en: Autoimmune hepatitis is liver inflammation that occurs when your body's immune system turns against liver cells. The exact cause of autoimmune hepatitis is unclear, but genetic and enviromental factors appear to interact over time in triggering the disease.Untreated autoimmune hepatitis can lead to scarring of the liver (cirrhosis) and eventually to liver failure. When diagnosed and treated early, however, autoimmune hepatitis often can be controlled with drugs that suppress the immune system.A liver transplant may be an option when autoimmune hepatitis doesn't respond to drug treatments or in cases of advanced liver disease.

title: 自身免疫性胰腺炎
desc: 自身免疫性胰腺炎是胰腺的炎症。这可能是由免疫系统攻击胰腺引起的。自身免疫性胰腺炎也称为 AIP。现在已认识到 AIP 的两种亚型：1 型和 2 型。1 型 AIP 称为 IgG4 相关疾病 (IgG4-RD)。这种类型通常影响多个器官，包括胰腺、肝脏胆管、唾液腺、肾脏和淋巴结。2 型 AIP 似乎仅影响胰腺，尽管约三分之一的 2 型 AIP 患者患有相关炎症性肠病1型AIP可被误诊为胰腺癌。这两种情况有重叠的症状，但治疗方法却截然不同，因此区分其中一种非常重要。
desc_en: Autoimmune pancreatitis is an inflammation in the pancreas. It may be caused by the immune system attacking the pancreas. Autoimmune pancreatitis also is called AIP. Two subtypes of AIP are now recognized, type 1 and type 2.Type 1 AIP is called IgG4-related disease (IgG4-RD). This type often affects multiple organs, including the pancreas, bile ducts in the liver, salivary glands, kidneys and lymph nodes.Type 2 AIP seems to affect only the pancreas, although about one-third of people with type 2 AIP have associated inflammatory bowel disease.Type 1 AIP can be mistakenly diagnosed as pancreatic cancer. The two conditions have overlapping symptoms, but very different treatments, so it is very important to distinguish one from the other.

title: 缺血性坏死（骨坏死）
desc: 缺血性坏死是骨组织由于缺乏血液供应而死亡。也称为骨坏死，它会导致骨骼微小断裂并导致骨骼塌陷。这个过程通常需要几个月到几年的时间。骨折或关节脱位可能会阻止血液流向骨头的一部分。股骨头缺血性坏死还与长期使用大剂量类固醇药物和过量饮酒有关。任何人都可能受到影响。但这种情况在 30 岁至 50 岁之间的人群中最常见。
desc_en: Avascular necrosis is the death of bone tissue due to a lack of blood supply. Also called osteonecrosis, it can lead to tiny breaks in the bone and cause the bone to collapse. The process usually takes months to years.A broken bone or dislocated joint can stop the blood flow to a section of bone. Avascular necrosis is also associated with long-term use of high-dose steroid medications and too much alcohol.Anyone can be affected. But the condition is most common in people between the ages of 30 and 50.

title: 婴儿痤疮
desc: 婴儿痤疮是一种导致新生儿皮肤出现小肿块的疾病，通常出现在面部和颈部。婴儿痤疮是常见且暂时的。您几乎无法预防它，而且它通常会自行消失，不会留下疤痕。这种情况的其他名称是婴儿痤疮和新生儿痤疮。
desc_en: Baby acne is a condition that causes small bumps on a newborn's skin — often on the face and neck. Baby acne is common and temporary. There's little you can do to prevent it, and it often clears up on its own without scarring.Other names for this condition are infantile acne and neonatal acne.

title: 背疼
desc: 背痛是人们寻求医疗帮助或旷工的最常见原因之一。背痛是全世界残疾的主要原因。幸运的是，采取措施可以帮助预防或缓解大多数背痛发作，特别是对于 60 岁以下的人。如果预防失败，简单的家庭治疗和正确使用身体通常可以在短时间内治愈背部。几个星期。很少需要手术来治疗背痛。
desc_en: Back pain is one of the most common reasons people seek medical help or miss work. Back pain is a leading cause of disability worldwide.Fortunately, measures can help prevent or relieve most back pain episodes, especially for people younger than age 60. If prevention fails, simple home treatment and using the body correctly often will heal the back within a few weeks. Surgery is rarely needed to treat back pain.

title: 细菌性阴道病
desc: 细菌性阴道病 (BV) 可导致阴道不适和疼痛。当自然细菌水平不平衡时就会发生这种情况。平衡的细菌水平有助于保持阴道健康。但当某些细菌生长过多时，就会导致细菌性阴道病。细菌性阴道病可能发生在任何年龄。但它在育龄期最常见。这段时间荷尔蒙的变化使某些细菌更容易生长。此外，细菌性阴道病在性活跃的人群中更为常见。目前还不清楚这是为什么。但无保护性行为和冲洗等活动会增加患细菌性阴道病的风险。
desc_en: Bacterial vaginosis (BV) can cause discomfort and pain of the vagina. It happens when natural bacteria levels are out of balance. Balanced levels of bacteria help keep the vagina healthy. But when too much of some bacteria grow, it can lead to BV.Bacterial vaginosis can happen at any age. But it's most common during the reproductive years. The changes in hormones during this time make it easier for certain kinds of bacteria to grow. Also, bacterial vaginosis is more common among those who are sexually active. It's not clear why this is. But activities such as unprotected sex and douching raise your risk of having BV.

title: 巴雷特食管
desc: 巴雷特食管是一种疾病，其中连接口腔和胃（食管）的吞咽管的扁平粉红色内壁因胃酸反流而受损，导致内壁增厚并变红。食管和胃之间是一个严重的问题。食管下括约肌 (LES) 是重要的瓣膜。随着时间的推移，LES 可能会开始失效，导致食道出现酸和化学损伤，这种情况称为胃食管反流病 (GERD)。 GERD 通常伴有胃灼热或反流等症状。在某些人中，这种胃食管反流病可能会引发食管下部的细胞发生变化，导致巴雷特食管。巴雷特食管与患食管癌的风险增加有关。尽管患食管癌的风险很小，但定期检查、仔细成像和广泛的食管活检以检查癌前细胞（发育异常）非常重要。如果发现癌前细胞，可以对其进行治疗以预防食道癌。
desc_en: Barrett's esophagus is a condition in which the flat pink lining of the swallowing tube that connects the mouth to the stomach (esophagus) becomes damaged by acid reflux, which causes the lining to thicken and become red.Between the esophagus and the stomach is a critically important valve, the lower esophageal sphincter (LES). Over time, the LES may begin to fail, leading to acid and chemical damage of the esophagus, a condition called gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). GERD is often accompanied by symptoms such as heartburn or regurgitation. In some people, this GERD may trigger a change in the cells lining the lower esophagus, causing Barrett's esophagus.Barrett's esophagus is associated with an increased risk of developing esophageal cancer. Although the risk of developing esophageal cancer is small, it's important to have regular checkups with careful imaging and extensive biopsies of the esophagus to check for precancerous cells (dysplasia). If precancerous cells are discovered, they can be treated to prevent esophageal cancer.

title: 蜜蜂蜇
desc: 蜜蜂蜇伤是一种常见的户外公害。在大多数情况下，蜜蜂蜇伤只是令人烦恼，家庭治疗就可以缓解疼痛。但是，如果您对蜂蜇过敏或者多次被蜇伤，您可能会出现更严重的反应，需要紧急治疗。您可以采取几个步骤来避免被蜂蜇（以及大黄蜂和黄蜂蜇伤），并找出答案如果您被蜇伤，如何治疗它们。
desc_en: Bee stings are a common outdoor nuisance. In most cases, bee stings are just annoying, and home treatment is all that's necessary to ease the pain. But if you're allergic to bee stings or you get stung numerous times, you may have a more-serious reaction that requires emergency treatment.You can take several steps to avoid bee stings — as well as hornet and wasp stings — and find out how to treat them if you do get stung.

title: 良性肾上腺肿瘤
desc: 良性肾上腺肿瘤是在肾上腺中形成的非癌性肿块。作为内分泌系统的一部分，肾上腺产生的激素向身体几乎每个器官和组织发出指令。您有两个肾上腺，每个肾脏上方都有一个。每个腺体包含两种组织类型：皮质和髓质。发生在皮质的良性肾上腺肿瘤也称为肾上腺腺瘤。发生在髓质的肿瘤也称为嗜铬细胞瘤 (fee-o-kroe-moe-sy-TOE-muhs)。大多数良性肾上腺肿瘤不会引起任何症状，不需要治疗。但有时这些肿瘤会分泌高水平的某些激素，从而导致并发症。最常见的过度分泌激素是皮质中的醛固酮和皮质醇以及髓质中的肾上腺素激素。在这些情况下，良性肾上腺肿瘤的治疗可能包括手术或药物治疗。梅奥诊所是美国规模最大、经验最丰富的诊所之一，在亚利桑那州、佛罗里达州和明尼苏达州设有分校。数十个专业领域的熟练工作人员共同努力，确保高质量的护理和成功的康复。内分泌研究人员正在进行内分泌失调和肾上腺疾病治疗的临床研究。了解有关 Major Clinics 内分泌学研究的更多信息。请参阅 Major Clinics 医生在 PubMed（国家医学图书馆的一项服务）上发表的有关良性肾上腺肿瘤的出版物列表。
type: Surgical Oncology and Endocrine Surgery in Arizona
desc_en:
Benign adrenal tumors are noncancerous masses that form in the adrenal glands. As part of the endocrine system, the adrenal glands produce hormones that give instructions to nearly every organ and tissue in the body.You have two adrenal glands, one located above each kidney. Each gland contains two tissue types: the cortex and the medulla. Benign adrenal tumors that develop in the cortex are also called adrenal adenomas. Those that develop in the medulla are also called pheochromocytomas (fee-o-kroe-moe-sy-TOE-muhs).Most benign adrenal tumors cause no symptoms and don't need treatment. But sometimes these tumors secrete high levels of certain hormones that can cause complications.The most common hormones that can be over-secreted are aldosterone and cortisol from the cortex and adrenalin hormones from the medulla. In these cases, benign adrenal tumor treatment may include surgery or medications.Major Clinics has one of the largest and most experienced practices in the United States,
with campuses in Arizona, Florida and Minnesota. Staff skilled in dozens of specialties work
together to ensure quality care and successful recovery.Endocrinology researchers conduct ongoing clinical studies of treatments for endocrine disorders and adrenal gland conditions. Read more about endocrinology research at Major Clinics.See a list of publications about benign adrenal tumors by Major Clinics doctors on PubMed, a service of the National Library of Medicine.

title: 良性阵发性位置性眩晕（BPPV）
desc: 良性阵发性位置性眩晕 (BPPV) 是眩晕最常见的原因之一，即突然感觉自己在旋转或头部内部在旋转。BPPV 会导致短暂的轻度至强烈头晕。它通常是由头部位置的特定变化触发的。当您抬起或低下头、躺下、翻身或在床上坐起时，可能会发生这种情况。虽然 BPPV 可能很麻烦，但很少会很严重，除非它会增加跌倒的机会。您可以在就诊期间接受有效的 BPPV 治疗。
desc_en: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) is one of the most common causes of vertigo — the sudden sensation that you're spinning or that the inside of your head is spinning.BPPV causes brief episodes of mild to intense dizziness. It is usually triggered by specific changes in your head's position. This might occur when you tip your head up or down, when you lie down, or when you turn over or sit up in bed.Although BPPV can be bothersome, it's rarely serious except when it increases the chance of falls. You can receive effective treatment for BPPV during a doctor's office visit.

title: 良性周围神经肿瘤
desc: 您的周围神经将大脑和脊髓与身体的其他部位连接起来。这些神经控制您的肌肉，以便您可以行走、眨眼、吞咽、捡起东西和进行其他活动。周围神经上可能会形成几种不同类型的肿瘤。这些肿瘤的病因通常未知。有些有遗传原因。这些类型的肿瘤大多数不是癌性的（良性）。但它们会导致神经损伤和肌肉失去控制。因此，当您出现任何异常肿块、疼痛、刺痛或麻木或肌肉无力时，务必去看医生。周围神经肿瘤通过在神经内生长或压迫神经来影响神经。在神经内生长的周围神经肿瘤称为神经内肿瘤。压迫神经的肿瘤称为神经外肿瘤。大多数是良性的，这意味着它们不是癌性的。不同类型的良性周围神经肿瘤包括：
desc_en: Your peripheral nerves link your brain and spinal cord to other parts of your body. These nerves control your muscles so that you can walk, blink, swallow, pick things up and do other activities.Several different types of tumors may form on the peripheral nerves. The cause of these tumors is usually unknown. Some have a genetic cause.Most of these types of tumors are not cancerous (benign). But they can lead to nerve damage and loss of muscle control. That's why it's important to see your health care provider when you have any unusual lump, pain, tingling or numbness, or muscle weakness.Peripheral nerve tumors affect nerves by growing within them or by pressing against them. Peripheral nerve tumors that grow within nerves are called intraneural tumors. The tumors that press against nerves are called extraneural tumors. Most are benign, meaning that they are not cancerous. Different types of benign peripheral nerve tumors include:

title: 良性前列腺增生（BPH）
desc: 良性前列腺增生（BPH）是一种随着年龄的增长而变得更加常见的健康问题。它也称为前列腺肥大。前列腺是一个有助于产生精液的小腺体。它位于膀胱下方。随着年龄的增长，它通常会变得更大。前列腺肥大可能会引起一些可能困扰您的症状，例如阻碍尿液从膀胱流出。它还可能导致膀胱、尿路或肾脏问题。许多治疗方法可以帮助治疗 BPH。这些包括药物、手术和其他程序。您的医疗保健提供者可以帮助您选择。正确的选择取决于以下因素：
desc_en: Benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) is a health issue that becomes more common with age. It's also called an enlarged prostate. The prostate is a small gland that helps make semen. It's found just below the bladder. And it often gets bigger as you get older.An enlarged prostate can cause symptoms that may bother you, such as blocking the flow of urine out of the bladder. It also can cause bladder, urinary tract or kidney problems.Many treatments can help BPH. These include medicines, surgery and other procedures. Your health care provider can help you choose. The right option depends on things such as:

title: 躁郁症
desc: 双相情感障碍，以前称为躁狂抑郁症，是一种心理健康状况，会导致情绪极度波动，包括​​情绪高涨（躁狂或轻躁狂）和情绪低落（抑郁）。当您变得抑郁时，您可能会感到悲伤或绝望，并对事物失去兴趣或乐趣。大多数活动。当您的情绪转变为躁狂或轻躁狂（没有躁狂那么极端）时，您可能会感到欣快、精力充沛或异常烦躁。这些情绪波动会影响睡眠、精力、活动、判断、行为和清晰思考的能力。情绪波动的发作可能很少发生，也可能一年多次发生。虽然大多数人会在两次发作之间经历一些情绪症状，但有些人可能不会经历任何症状。虽然双相情感障碍是一种终生疾病，但您可以通过遵循治疗计划来控制情绪波动和其他症状。在大多数情况下，双相情感障碍可以通过药物和心理咨询（心理治疗）进行治疗。梅奥诊所的双相情感障碍护理
desc_en: Bipolar disorder, formerly called manic depression, is a mental health condition that causes extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression).When you become depressed, you may feel sad or hopeless and lose interest or pleasure in most activities. When your mood shifts to mania or hypomania (less extreme than mania), you may feel euphoric, full of energy or unusually irritable. These mood swings can affect sleep, energy, activity, judgment, behavior and the ability to think clearly.Episodes of mood swings may occur rarely or multiple times a year. While most people will experience some emotional symptoms between episodes, some may not experience any.Although bipolar disorder is a lifelong condition, you can manage your mood swings and other symptoms by following a treatment plan. In most cases, bipolar disorder is treated with medications and psychological counseling (psychotherapy).Bipolar disorder care at Major Clinics

title: 舌头有黑毛
desc: 黑毛舌是一种使舌头看起来呈黑色、毛茸茸的状况。这种外观通常是由于舌头表面许多微小的圆形肿块上堆积了死皮细胞所致。这些肿块称为乳头，含有味蕾。当这些肿块变得比平时更长时，它们很容易被烟草、食物、饮料、细菌或酵母或其他物质困住和污染。黑毛舌头可能看起来令人担忧，但它通常是无痛的，不会引起任何健康问题。通过解决病因并定期清洁口腔和舌头，这种情况通常会消失。
desc_en: Black hairy tongue is a condition of the tongue that gives it a dark, furry look. The look usually results from a buildup of dead skin cells on the many tiny, rounded bumps on the surface of the tongue. These bumps, called papillae, contain taste buds. When these bumps become longer than usual, they can easily trap and be stained by tobacco, food, drinks, bacteria or yeast, or other substances.Black hairy tongue may look alarming, but it's usually painless and doesn't cause any health problems. The condition usually goes away by dealing with the causes and by regular mouth and tongue cleaning.

title: 膀胱癌
desc: 膀胱癌是一种常见的癌症，始于膀胱细胞。膀胱是下腹部的一个中空肌肉器官，用于储存尿液。膀胱癌最常始于膀胱内部的细胞（尿路上皮细胞）。尿路上皮细胞也存在于您的肾脏和连接肾脏与膀胱的管道（输尿管）中。尿路上皮癌也可能发生在肾脏和输尿管中，但在膀胱中更为常见。大多数膀胱癌都是在早期阶段诊断出来的，此时癌症的治愈率很高。但即使是早期膀胱癌在成功治疗后也可能复发。因此，膀胱癌患者通常需要在治疗后数年进行后续检查，以寻找膀胱癌复发的情况。
desc_en: Bladder cancer is a common type of cancer that begins in the cells of the bladder. The bladder is a hollow muscular organ in your lower abdomen that stores urine.Bladder cancer most often begins in the cells (urothelial cells) that line the inside of your bladder. Urothelial cells are also found in your kidneys and the tubes (ureters) that connect the kidneys to the bladder. Urothelial cancer can happen in the kidneys and ureters, too, but it's much more common in the bladder.Most bladder cancers are diagnosed at an early stage, when the cancer is highly treatable. But even early-stage bladder cancers can come back after successful treatment. For this reason, people with bladder cancer typically need follow-up tests for years after treatment to look for bladder cancer that recurs.

title: 膀胱外翻
desc: 膀胱外翻 (EK-stroh-fee) 是一种罕见的出生缺陷，膀胱在胎儿体外发育。暴露的膀胱无法储存尿液或正常发挥功能，导致漏尿（失禁）。膀胱外翻引起的问题的严重程度各不相同。它们可能包括膀胱、生殖器和骨盆骨的缺陷，以及肠道和生殖器官的缺陷。怀孕期间的常规超声检查可能会发现膀胱外翻。但有时，这种缺陷直到婴儿出生后才显现出来。出生时患有膀胱外翻的婴儿需要手术来纠正缺陷。
desc_en: Bladder exstrophy (EK-stroh-fee) is a rare birth defect in which the bladder develops outside the fetus. The exposed bladder can't store urine or function normally, resulting in urine leakage (incontinence).Problems caused by bladder exstrophy vary in severity. They can include defects in the bladder, genitals and pelvic bones, as well as defects in the intestines and reproductive organs.Bladder exstrophy may be spotted on a routine ultrasound during pregnancy. Sometimes, though, the defect isn't visible until the baby is born. Babies born with bladder exstrophy will need surgery to correct the defects.

title: 尿中带血（血尿）
desc: 尿液中带血（也称为血尿）可能会很可怕。在许多情况下，其原因是无害的。但尿中带血也可能是严重疾病的征兆。如果您能看到血液，则称为肉眼血尿。肉眼看不见的血液称为镜下血尿。它的量是如此之小，以至于实验室测试尿液时只能在显微镜下才能看到。不管怎样，找出出血的原因很重要。治疗取决于原因。
desc_en: It can be scary to see blood in urine, also called hematuria. In many cases, the cause is harmless. But blood in urine also can be a sign of a serious illness.If you can see the blood, it's called gross hematuria. Blood that can't be seen with the naked eye is called microscopic hematuria. It's such a small amount that it can be seen only under a microscope when a lab tests the urine. Either way, it's important to figure out the reason for the bleeding.Treatment depends on the cause.

title: 体虱
desc: 身体变形障碍是一种心理健康状况，在这种情况下，您无法停止思考自己外表上的一个或多个感知到的缺陷或缺陷——一种看起来很小或别人看不到的缺陷。但您可能会感到如此尴尬、羞愧和焦虑，以至于您可能会避免许多社交场合。当您患有身体变形障碍时，您会高度关注自己的外表和身体形象，反复检查镜子、梳洗或寻求安慰，有时每次会持续几个小时天。您认为的缺陷和重复的行为会给您带来巨大的痛苦，并影响您日常生活的能力。您可能会寻求多种整容手术来尝试“修复”您认为的缺陷。之后，您可能会感到暂时的满足或痛苦减轻，但焦虑通常会卷土重来，您可能会继续寻找其他方法来修复您感知到的缺陷。身体变形障碍的治疗可能包括认知行为疗法和药物治疗。
desc_en: Body dysmorphic disorder is a mental health condition in which you can't stop thinking about one or more perceived defects or flaws in your appearance — a flaw that appears minor or can't be seen by others. But you may feel so embarrassed, ashamed and anxious that you may avoid many social situations.When you have body dysmorphic disorder, you intensely focus on your appearance and body image, repeatedly checking the mirror, grooming or seeking reassurance, sometimes for many hours each day. Your perceived flaw and the repetitive behaviors cause you significant distress and impact your ability to function in your daily life.You may seek out numerous cosmetic procedures to try to "fix" your perceived flaw. Afterward, you may feel temporary satisfaction or a reduction in your distress, but often the anxiety returns and you may resume searching for other ways to fix your perceived flaw.Treatment of body dysmorphic disorder may include cognitive behavioral therapy and medication.

title: 骨癌
desc: 骨癌可以始于身体的任何骨骼，但最常见的是影响骨盆或手臂和腿部的长骨。骨癌很罕见，仅占所有癌症的不到 1%。事实上，非癌性骨肿瘤比癌性骨肿瘤更常见。“骨癌”一词不包括从身体其他部位开始并扩散（转移）到骨骼的癌症。相反，这些癌症是根据它们开始的位置来命名的，例如已经转移到骨骼的乳腺癌。某些类型的骨癌主要发生在儿童中，而其他类型的骨癌主要影响成年人。手术切除是最常见的治疗方法，但也可以采用化疗和放射疗法。使用手术、化疗或放疗的决定取决于所治疗的骨癌的类型。
type: Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Bone cancer can begin in any bone in the body, but it most commonly affects the pelvis or the long bones in the arms and legs. Bone cancer is rare, making up less than 1 percent of all cancers. In fact, noncancerous bone tumors are much more common than cancerous ones.The term "bone cancer" doesn't include cancers that begin elsewhere in the body and spread (metastasize) to the bone. Instead, those cancers are named for where they began, such as breast cancer that has metastasized to the bone.Some types of bone cancer occur primarily in children, while others affect mostly adults. Surgical removal is the most common treatment, but chemotherapy and radiation therapy also may be utilized. The decision to use surgery, chemotherapy or radiation therapy is based on the type of bone cancer being treated.

title: 臂丛神经损伤
desc: 臂丛神经是将信号从脊髓发送到肩膀、手臂和手的神经网络。当这些神经被拉伸、压缩，或者在最严重的情况下，从脊髓中撕裂或撕裂时，就会发生臂丛神经损伤。轻微的臂丛神经损伤，称为刺伤或烧伤，在接触性运动中很常见，例如足球。婴儿有时在出生时会遭受臂丛神经损伤。其他情况，例如炎症或肿瘤，可能会影响臂丛神经。最严重的臂丛神经损伤通常是由汽车或摩托车事故引起的。严重的臂丛神经损伤会使手臂瘫痪，但手术可能有助于恢复功能。
desc_en: The brachial plexus is the network of nerves that sends signals from the spinal cord to the shoulder, arm and hand. A brachial plexus injury occurs when these nerves are stretched, compressed, or in the most serious cases, ripped apart or torn away from the spinal cord.Minor brachial plexus injuries, known as stingers or burners, are common in contact sports, such as football. Babies sometimes sustain brachial plexus injuries during birth. Other conditions, such as inflammation or tumors, may affect the brachial plexus.The most severe brachial plexus injuries usually result from automobile or motorcycle accidents. Severe brachial plexus injuries can leave the arm paralyzed, but surgery may help restore function.

title: 脑 AVM（动静脉畸形）
desc: 心动过缓 (brad-e-KAHR-dee-uh) 是一种心率缓慢的疾病。成年人休息时的心脏通常每分钟跳动 60 至 100 次。如果您患有心动过缓，则您的心脏每分钟跳动少于 60 次。如果心率非常慢并且心脏无法向身体泵送足够的富氧血液，那么心动过缓可能会是一个严重的问题。如果发生这种情况，您可能会感到头晕、非常疲倦或虚弱以及呼吸急促。有时心动过缓不会引起症状或并发症。心率缓慢并不总是一个问题。例如，在睡眠期间，静息心率在每分钟 40 至 60 次之间是很常见的，对于某些人来说，尤其是健康的年轻人和训练有素的运动员。如果心动过缓严重，可能需要植入起搏器来帮助心脏保持适当的心率。速度。
desc_en: Bradycardia (brad-e-KAHR-dee-uh) is a slow heart rate. The hearts of adults at rest usually beat between 60 and 100 times a minute. If you have bradycardia, your heart beats fewer than 60 times a minute.Bradycardia can be a serious problem if the heart rate is very slow and the heart can't pump enough oxygen-rich blood to the body. If this happens, you may feel dizzy, very tired or weak, and short of breath. Sometimes bradycardia doesn't cause symptoms or complications.A slow heart rate isn't always a concern. For example, a resting heart rate between 40 and 60 beats a minute is quite common during sleep and in some people, particularly healthy young adults and trained athletes.If bradycardia is severe, an implanted pacemaker may be needed to help the heart maintain an appropriate rate.

title: 脑动脉瘤
desc: 脑动脉瘤 (AN-yoo-riz-um) — 也称为脑动脉瘤或颅内动脉瘤 — 是大脑血管中的隆起或膨胀。动脉瘤通常看起来像挂在茎上的浆果。专家认为，脑动脉瘤的形成和生长是因为流经血管的血液对血管壁的薄弱区域施加压力。这会增加脑动脉瘤的大小。如果脑动脉瘤渗漏或破裂，会导致大脑出血，称为出血性中风。最常见的是，破裂的脑动脉瘤发生在大脑和覆盖大脑的薄组织之间的空间。这种类型的出血性中风称为蛛网膜下腔出血。脑动脉瘤很常见。但大多数脑动脉瘤并不严重，尤其是当它们很小时。大多数脑动脉瘤不会破裂。它们通常不会引起症状或引起健康问题。在许多情况下，脑动脉瘤是在其他情况的检查中发现的。然而，破裂的动脉瘤很快就会危及生命，需要立即接受治疗。如果脑动脉瘤尚未破裂，在某些情况下治疗可能是合适的。治疗未破裂的脑动脉瘤可能会预防未来的破裂。与您的医疗保健提供者交谈，以确保您了解满足您特定需求的最佳选择。
desc_en: A brain aneurysm (AN-yoo-riz-um) — also known as a cerebral aneurysm or intracranial aneurysm — is a bulge or ballooning in a blood vessel in the brain. An aneurysm often looks like a berry hanging on a stem.Experts think brain aneurysms form and grow because blood flowing through the blood vessel puts pressure on a weak area of the vessel wall. This can increase the size of the brain aneurysm. If the brain aneurysm leaks or ruptures, it causes bleeding in the brain, known as a hemorrhagic stroke.Most often, a ruptured brain aneurysm occurs in the space between the brain and the thin tissues covering the brain. This type of hemorrhagic stroke is called a subarachnoid hemorrhage.Brain aneurysms are common. But most brain aneurysms aren't serious, especially if they're small. Most brain aneurysms don't rupture. They usually don't cause symptoms or cause health problems. In many cases, brain aneurysms are found during tests for other conditions.However, a ruptured aneurysm quickly becomes life-threatening and requires medical treatment right away.If a brain aneurysm hasn't ruptured, treatment may be appropriate in some cases. Treatment of an unruptured brain aneurysm may prevent a rupture in the future. Talk with your health care provider to make sure you understand the best options for your specific needs.

title: 脑肿瘤
desc: 脑肿瘤是大脑中或大脑附近细胞的生长。脑肿瘤可能发生在脑组织中。脑肿瘤也可能发生在脑组织附近。附近的位置包括神经、垂体、松果体和覆盖大脑表面的膜。脑肿瘤可以始于大脑。这些被称为原发性脑肿瘤。有时，癌症从身体的其他部位扩散到大脑。这些肿瘤是继发性脑肿瘤，也称为转移性脑肿瘤。存在许多不同类型的原发性脑肿瘤。有些脑肿瘤不是癌性的。这些被称为非癌性脑肿瘤或良性脑肿瘤。非癌性脑肿瘤可能会随着时间的推移而生长并压迫脑组织。其他脑肿瘤是脑癌，也称为恶性脑肿瘤。脑癌可能会快速生长。癌细胞可以侵入并破坏脑组织。脑肿瘤的大小从非常小到非常大。有些脑肿瘤在很小的时候就被发现，因为它们会引起您立即注意到的症状。其他脑肿瘤在被发现之前会长得很大。大脑的某些部分不如其他部分活跃。如果脑肿瘤起源于大脑不太活跃的部分，它可能不会立即引起症状。在检测到肿瘤之前，脑肿瘤的大小可能会变得相当大。脑肿瘤的治疗方案取决于您患有的脑肿瘤的类型及其大小和位置。常见的治疗方法包括手术和放射治疗。脑肿瘤有多种类型。脑肿瘤的类型取决于构成肿瘤的细胞类型。对肿瘤细胞的特殊实验室测试可以提供有关细胞的信息。您的医疗团队使用此信息来确定脑肿瘤的类型。某些类型的脑肿瘤通常不是癌性的。这些被称为非癌性脑肿瘤或良性脑肿瘤。某些类型的脑肿瘤通常是癌性的。这些类型称为脑癌或恶性脑肿瘤。某些脑肿瘤类型可以是良性或恶性。良性脑肿瘤往往是生长缓慢的脑肿瘤。恶性脑肿瘤往往是快速生长的脑肿瘤。脑肿瘤的类型包括：
desc_en: A brain tumor is a growth of cells in the brain or near it. Brain tumors can happen in the brain tissue. Brain tumors also can happen near the brain tissue. Nearby locations include nerves, the pituitary gland, the pineal gland, and the membranes that cover the surface of the brain.Brain tumors can begin in the brain. These are called primary brain tumors. Sometimes, cancer spreads to the brain from other parts of the body. These tumors are secondary brain tumors, also called metastatic brain tumors.Many different types of primary brain tumors exist. Some brain tumors aren't cancerous. These are called noncancerous brain tumors or benign brain tumors. Noncancerous brain tumors may grow over time and press on the brain tissue. Other brain tumors are brain cancers, also called malignant brain tumors. Brain cancers may grow quickly. The cancer cells can invade and destroy the brain tissue.Brain tumors range in size from very small to very large. Some brain tumors are found when they are very small because they cause symptoms that you notice right away. Other brain tumors grow very large before they're found. Some parts of the brain are less active than others. If a brain tumor starts in a part of the brain that's less active, it might not cause symptoms right away. The brain tumor size could become quite large before the tumor is detected.Brain tumor treatment options depend on the type of brain tumor you have, as well as its size and location. Common treatments include surgery and radiation therapy.There are many types of brain tumors. The type of brain tumor is based on the kind of cells that make up the tumor. Special lab tests on the tumor cells can give information about the cells. Your health care team uses this information to figure out the type of brain tumor.Some types of brain tumors usually aren't cancerous. These are called noncancerous brain tumors or benign brain tumors. Some types of brain tumors usually are cancerous. These types are called brain cancers or malignant brain tumors. Some brain tumor types can be benign or malignant.Benign brain tumors tend to be slow-growing brain tumors. Malignant brain tumors tend to be fast-growing brain tumors.Types of brain tumors include:

title: 乳腺癌
desc: 乳腺癌是一种始于乳腺组织细胞生长的癌症。乳腺癌是继皮肤癌之后美国女性最常见的癌症。但乳腺癌不仅仅发生在女性身上。每个人出生时都有一些乳腺组织，因此任何人都可能患乳腺癌。乳腺癌的存活率一直在增加。死于乳腺癌的人数正在稳步下降。这在很大程度上要归功于对乳腺癌认识的广泛支持和对研究的资助。乳腺癌筛查的进步使医疗保健专业人员能够更早地诊断乳腺癌。越早发现癌症，治愈癌症的可能性就越大。即使乳腺癌无法治愈，仍有许多治疗方法可以延长生命。乳腺癌研究的新发现正在帮助医疗保健专业人员选择最有效的治疗计划。梅奥诊所的乳腺癌护理
type: Surgical Oncology and Endocrine Surgery in Arizona
desc_en: Breast cancer is a kind of cancer that begins as a growth of cells in the breast tissue.After skin cancer, breast cancer is the most common cancer diagnosed in women in the United States. But breast cancer doesn't just happen in women. Everyone is born with some breast tissue, so anyone can get breast cancer.Breast cancer survival rates have been increasing. And the number of people dying of breast cancer is steadily going down. Much of this is due to the widespread support for breast cancer awareness and funding for research.Advances in breast cancer screening allow healthcare professionals to diagnose breast cancer earlier. Finding the cancer earlier makes it much more likely that the cancer can be cured. Even when breast cancer can't be cured, many treatments exist to extend life. New discoveries in breast cancer research are helping healthcare professionals choose the most effective treatment plans.Breast cancer care at Major Clinics

title: 乳腺囊肿
desc: 乳腺囊肿是乳房内充满液体的囊。它们通常是非癌性的（良性的）。您可能有一个或多个乳腺囊肿。乳房囊肿通常感觉像葡萄或充满水的气球，但有时乳房囊肿感觉很硬。除非囊肿很大且疼痛或不舒服，否则不需要治疗。在这种情况下，排出乳腺囊肿中的液体可以缓解症状。虽然乳腺囊肿可见于任何年龄的女性，但更常见于绝经前的女性，通常是 50 岁以下。乳腺囊肿也常见于绝经后女性接受激素治疗的人。
desc_en: Breast cysts are fluid-filled sacs inside the breast. They are usually noncancerous (benign). You may have one or multiple breast cysts. A breast cyst often feels like a grape or a water-filled balloon, but sometimes a breast cyst feels firm.Breast cysts don't require treatment unless a cyst is large and painful or uncomfortable. In that case, draining the fluid from a breast cyst can ease symptoms.Although breast cysts can be found in women of any age, they're more common in women before menopause, typically under age 50. Breast cysts also commonly occur in postmenopausal women who take hormone therapy.

title: 断臂
desc: 手臂骨折涉及手臂三块骨头中的一块或多块——尺骨、桡骨和肱骨。手臂骨折的最常见原因之一是跌倒时手伸直。如果您认为您或您的孩子手臂骨折，请立即就医。尽快治疗骨折以使其正常愈合非常重要。治疗取决于受伤的部位和严重程度。简单的休息可以用吊索、冰敷和休息来治疗。然而，骨头可能需要在急诊室重新排列（复位）。更复杂的骨折可能需要手术来重新排列断裂的骨头，并植入金属丝、板、钉子或螺钉，以在愈合过程中将骨头保持在适当的位置。
type: Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: A broken arm involves one or more of the three bones in your arm — the ulna, radius and humerus. One of the most common causes of a broken arm is falling onto an outstretched hand. If you think you or your child has broken an arm, seek prompt medical attention. It's important to treat a fracture as soon as possible for proper healing.Treatment depends on the site and severity of the injury. A simple break might be treated with a sling, ice and rest. However, the bone may require realignment (reduction) in the emergency room.A more complicated break might require surgery to realign the broken bone and to implant wires, plates, nails or screws to keep the bone in place during healing.

title: 心碎综合症
desc: 心碎综合症是一种通常由压力情况和极端情绪引起的心脏病。这种情况也可能由严重的身体疾病或手术引发。心碎综合症通常是暂时的。但有些人在心脏痊愈后可能会继续感到不适。患有心碎综合症的人可能会突然胸痛或认为自己心脏病发作。心碎综合症仅影响心脏的一部分。它会短暂中断心脏泵血的方式。心脏的其余部分继续像往常一样工作。有时心脏收缩得更有力。药物可用于治疗心碎综合症的症状。心碎综合症也可称为：
desc_en: Broken heart syndrome is a heart condition that's often brought on by stressful situations and extreme emotions. The condition also can be triggered by a serious physical illness or surgery. Broken heart syndrome is usually temporary. But some people may continue to feel unwell after the heart is healed.People with broken heart syndrome may have sudden chest pain or think they're having a heart attack. Broken heart syndrome affects just part of the heart. It briefly interrupts the way the heart pumps blood. The rest of the heart continues to work as usual. Sometimes the heart contracts more forcefully.Medicines are used to treat symptoms of broken heart syndrome.Broken heart syndrome also may be called:

title: 断腿
desc: 腿骨折（腿部骨折）是指腿上的一根骨头断裂或破裂。常见原因包括跌倒、机动车事故和运动损伤。腿部骨折的治疗取决于受伤的位置和严重程度。严重折断的腿可能需要金属销钉和金属板将碎片固定在一起。不太严重的骨折可以用石膏或夹板治疗。在所有情况下，及时诊断和治疗对于完全康复至关重要。
desc_en: A broken leg (leg fracture) is a break or crack in one of the bones in your leg. Common causes include falls, motor vehicle accidents and sports injuries.Treatment of a broken leg depends on the location and severity of the injury. A severely broken leg may require metal pins and plates to hold the fragments together. Less severe breaks may be treated with a cast or splint. In all cases, prompt diagnosis and treatment are critical to complete healing.

title: 细支气管炎
desc: 细支气管炎是幼儿和婴儿常见的肺部感染。它会导致肺部小气道肿胀和刺激以及粘液积聚。这些小气道称为细支气管。细支气管炎几乎总是由病毒引起。细支气管炎最初的症状与普通感冒很相似。但随后情况会变得更糟，导致咳嗽和呼气时发出尖锐的哨声，称为喘息。有时孩子会出现呼吸困难。细支气管炎的症状可持续 1 至 2 周，但偶尔会持续更长时间。大多数儿童在家庭护理下会好转。少数儿童需要住院治疗。
desc_en: Bronchiolitis is a common lung infection in young children and infants. It causes swelling and irritation and a buildup of mucus in the small airways of the lung. These small airways are called bronchioles. Bronchiolitis is almost always caused by a virus.Bronchiolitis starts out with symptoms much like a common cold. But then it gets worse, causing coughing and a high-pitched whistling sound when breathing out called wheezing. Sometimes children have trouble breathing. Symptoms of bronchiolitis can last for 1 to 2 weeks but occasionally can last longer.Most children get better with care at home. A small number of children need a stay in the hospital.

title: 支气管炎
desc: 支气管炎是支气管内壁的炎症，支气管负责将空气输送到肺部或从肺部排出。患有支气管炎的人经常会咳出粘稠的粘液，粘液可能会变色。支气管炎可以是急性的，也可以是慢性的。急性支气管炎通常由感冒或其他呼吸道感染引起，非常常见。慢性支气管炎是一种更严重的疾病，是支气管内壁的持续刺激或炎症，通常是由于吸烟引起的。急性支气管炎，也称为胸部感冒，通常会在一周至 10 天内改善，但不会产生持久影响，尽管咳嗽可能会持续数周。但是，如果支气管炎反复发作，则可能患有慢性支气管炎，需要就医。慢性支气管炎是慢性阻塞性肺病（COPD）的病症之一。
desc_en: Bronchitis is an inflammation of the lining of your bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from your lungs. People who have bronchitis often cough up thickened mucus, which can be discolored. Bronchitis may be either acute or chronic.Often developing from a cold or other respiratory infection, acute bronchitis is very common. Chronic bronchitis, a more serious condition, is a constant irritation or inflammation of the lining of the bronchial tubes, often due to smoking.Acute bronchitis, also called a chest cold, usually improves within a week to 10 days without lasting effects, although the cough may linger for weeks.However, if you have repeated bouts of bronchitis, you may have chronic bronchitis, which requires medical attention. Chronic bronchitis is one of the conditions included in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

title: 磨牙症（磨牙）
desc: 磨牙症 (BRUK-siz-um) 是一种磨牙、咬牙或咬紧牙齿的症状。如果您患有磨牙症，您可能会在清醒时无意识地咬紧牙齿（清醒磨牙症），或在睡眠时咬紧或磨牙（睡眠磨牙症）。睡眠磨牙症被认为是一种与睡眠相关的运动障碍。睡眠时紧咬或磨牙（磨牙）的人更有可能患有其他睡眠障碍，例如打鼾和呼吸暂停（睡眠呼吸暂停）。轻度磨牙症可能不需要治疗。然而，对于某些人来说，磨牙症可能很频繁且严重，足以导致下颌紊乱、头痛、牙齿受损和其他问题。因为您可能患有睡眠磨牙症，并且直到出现并发症才意识到这一点，因此了解其体征和症状非常重要磨牙症并寻求定期的牙科护理。
desc_en: Bruxism (BRUK-siz-um) is a condition in which you grind, gnash or clench your teeth. If you have bruxism, you may unconsciously clench your teeth when you're awake (awake bruxism) or clench or grind them during sleep (sleep bruxism).Sleep bruxism is considered a sleep-related movement disorder. People who clench or grind their teeth (brux) during sleep are more likely to have other sleep disorders, such as snoring and pauses in breathing (sleep apnea).Mild bruxism may not require treatment. However, in some people, bruxism can be frequent and severe enough to lead to jaw disorders, headaches, damaged teeth and other problems.Because you may have sleep bruxism and be unaware of it until complications develop, it's important to know the signs and symptoms of bruxism and to seek regular dental care.

title: 神经性贪食症
desc: 神经性贪食症（boo-LEE-me-uh），通常称为暴食症，是一种严重的、可能危及生命的饮食失调症。患有贪食症的人可能会偷偷地暴饮暴食，吃大量的食物，但对饮食失去控制，然后进行净化，试图以不健康的方式消除多余的卡路里。为了消除卡路里并防止体重增加，患有贪食症的人暴食症可能会使用不同的方法。例如，您可能经常在暴饮暴食后自行催吐或滥用泻药、减肥补充剂、利尿剂或灌肠剂。或者您可以使用其他方法来消除卡路里并防止体重增加，例如禁食、严格节食或过度运动。如果您患有贪食症，您可能会全神贯注于自己的体重和体形。你可能会因为自己认为的缺陷而严厉地评判自己。因为贪食症与自我形象有关，而不仅仅是与食物有关，所以很难克服。但有效的治疗可以帮助您自我感觉更好，采取更健康的饮食模式并扭转严重的并发症。
desc_en: Bulimia (boo-LEE-me-uh) nervosa, commonly called bulimia, is a serious, potentially life-threatening eating disorder. People with bulimia may secretly binge — eating large amounts of food with a loss of control over the eating — and then purge, trying to get rid of the extra calories in an unhealthy way.To get rid of calories and prevent weight gain, people with bulimia may use different methods. For example, you may regularly self-induce vomiting or misuse laxatives, weight-loss supplements, diuretics or enemas after bingeing. Or you may use other ways to rid yourself of calories and prevent weight gain, such as fasting, strict dieting or excessive exercise.If you have bulimia, you're probably preoccupied with your weight and body shape. You may judge yourself severely and harshly for your self-perceived flaws. Because it's related to self-image — and not just about food — bulimia can be hard to overcome. But effective treatment can help you feel better about yourself, adopt healthier eating patterns and reverse serious complications.

title: 大疱性类天疱疮
desc: 大疱性类天疱疮 (BUL-us PEM-fih-goid) 是一种罕见的皮肤病，会导致充满液体的大水泡。它们生长在经常弯曲的皮肤区域，例如下腹部、大腿上部或腋窝。大疱性类天疱疮最常见于老年人。当您的免疫系统攻击皮肤外层下方的薄层组织时，就会发生大疱性类天疱疮。这种异常免疫反应的原因尚不清楚，尽管有时可以通过服用某些药物来触发。大疱性类天疱疮通常会在几个月内自行消失，但可能需要长达五年的时间才能消退。治疗通常有助于治愈水泡并缓解瘙痒。它可能包括皮质类固醇药物，例如泼尼松，以及其他抑制免疫系统的药物。大疱性类天疱疮可能危及生命，特别是对于健康状况不佳的老年人而言。
desc_en: Bullous pemphigoid (BUL-us PEM-fih-goid) is a rare skin condition that causes large, fluid-filled blisters. They develop on areas of skin that often flex — such as the lower abdomen, upper thighs or armpits. Bullous pemphigoid is most common in older adults.Bullous pemphigoid occurs when your immune system attacks a thin layer of tissue below your outer layer of skin. The reason for this abnormal immune response is unknown, although it sometimes can be triggered by taking certain medications.Bullous pemphigoid often goes away on its own in a few months, but may take as many as five years to resolve. Treatment usually helps heal the blisters and ease any itching. It may include corticosteroid medications, such as prednisone, and other drugs that suppress the immune system. Bullous pemphigoid can be life-threatening, especially for older people who are already in poor health.

title: 灼口综合征
desc: 灼口综合症是一个医学术语，指没有明显原因的持续或反复出现的口腔灼烧感。您可能会在舌头、牙龈、嘴唇、脸颊内侧、上颚或整个口腔的大片区域感到灼烧感。灼烧感可能会很严重，就好像您用非常热的饮料弄伤了嘴一样。灼口综合症通常会突然发生，但随着时间的推移，它可能会慢慢发展。通常无法找到具体原因。尽管这使治疗变得更具挑战性，但与您的医疗团队密切合作可以帮助您减轻症状。
desc_en: Burning mouth syndrome is the medical term for ongoing or recurring burning in the mouth without an obvious cause. You may feel this burning on your tongue, gums, lips, inside of your cheeks, roof of your mouth or large areas of your whole mouth. The feeling of burning can be severe, as if you injured your mouth with a very hot drink.Burning mouth syndrome usually comes on suddenly, but it can develop slowly over time. Often the specific cause can't be found. Although that makes treatment more challenging, working closely with your health care team can help you reduce symptoms.

title: 伯恩斯
desc: 烧伤是由于高温、过度暴露于阳光或其他辐射、或者化学或电接触而导致的组织损伤。烧伤可能是轻微的医疗问题，也可能是危及生命的紧急情况。烧伤的治疗取决于损伤的位置和严重程度。晒伤和小烫伤通常可以在家治疗。深度或大面积烧伤需要立即就医。有些人需要在专门的烧伤中心接受治疗和长达数月的后续护理。
type: Trauma, Critical Care and General Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Burns are tissue damage that results from heat, overexposure to the sun or other radiation, or chemical or electrical contact. Burns can be minor medical problems or life-threatening emergencies.The treatment of burns depends on the location and severity of the damage. Sunburns and small scalds can usually be treated at home. Deep or widespread burns need immediate medical attention. Some people need treatment at specialized burn centers and monthslong follow-up care.

title: 滑囊炎
desc: 滑囊炎 (bur-SY-tis) 是一种疼痛性疾病，会影响充满液体的小囊（称为滑囊 (bur-SEE)），这些囊可缓冲关节附近的骨骼、肌腱和肌肉。当滑囊发炎时就会发生滑囊炎。滑囊炎最常见的部位是肩部、肘部和臀部。但膝盖、脚后跟和大脚趾根部也可能患有滑囊炎。滑囊炎通常发生在进行频繁重复运动的关节附近。治疗通常包括让受影响的关节休息并保护其免受进一步的创伤。在大多数情况下，经过适当治疗，滑囊炎疼痛会在几周内消失，但滑囊炎反复发作也很常见。
type: Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Bursitis (bur-SY-tis) is a painful condition that affects the small, fluid-filled sacs — called bursae (bur-SEE) — that cushion the bones, tendons and muscles near your joints. Bursitis occurs when bursae become inflamed.The most common locations for bursitis are in the shoulder, elbow and hip. But you can also have bursitis by your knee, heel and the base of your big toe. Bursitis often occurs near joints that perform frequent repetitive motion.Treatment typically involves resting the affected joint and protecting it from further trauma. In most cases, bursitis pain goes away within a few weeks with proper treatment, but recurrent flare-ups of bursitis are common.

title: 钙化防御
desc: 钙防御 (kal-sih-fuh-LAK-sis) 是一种严重的罕见疾病，钙在脂肪和皮肤组织的小血管中积聚。钙防御会导致血栓、皮肤溃疡，并可能引起严重感染，从而导致死亡。患有钙化防御的人通常患有肾功能衰竭，正在接受透析或进行过肾移植。这种情况也可能发生在没有肾脏疾病的人身上。
desc_en: Calciphylaxis (kal-sih-fuh-LAK-sis) is a serious, uncommon disease in which calcium accumulates in small blood vessels of the fat and skin tissues.Calciphylaxis causes blood clots, painful skin ulcers and may cause serious infections that can lead to death. People who have calciphylaxis usually have kidney failure and are on dialysis or have had a kidney transplant. The condition can also occur in people without kidney disease.

title: 癌症
desc: 癌症是指以异常细胞发展为特征的大量疾病中的任何一种，这些异常细胞不受控制地分裂并具有渗透和破坏正常身体组织的能力。癌症通常具有扩散到全身的能力。癌症是世界上第二大死因。但由于癌症筛查、治疗和预防方面的改进，许多类型癌症的生存率正在提高。
type: Adolescent and Young Adult Cancer Program
Blood and Marrow Stem Cell Transplantation Clinic in Minnesota
Oral and Maxillofacial Oncology and Reconstruction Clinic
Oral Cavity Cancer and Reconstruction Clinic in Minnesota
Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
Surgical Oncology and Endocrine Surgery in Arizona
Trauma, Critical Care and General Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Cancer refers to any one of a large number of diseases characterized by the development of abnormal cells that divide uncontrollably and have the ability to infiltrate and destroy normal body tissue. Cancer often has the ability to spread throughout your body.Cancer is the second-leading cause of death in the world. But survival rates are improving for many types of cancer, thanks to improvements in cancer screening, treatment and prevention.

title: 一氧化碳中毒
desc: 当一氧化碳在血液中积聚时，就会发生一氧化碳中毒。当空气中一氧化碳过多时，身体就会用一氧化碳代替红细胞中的氧气。这可能会导致严重的组织损伤，甚至死亡。一氧化碳是没有气味、味道或颜色的气体。燃烧燃料，包括天然气、木材、丙烷或木炭，会产生一氧化碳。通风不良的电器和发动机可能会导致气体积聚到危险水平。封闭的空间会使积聚变得更严重。任何接触一氧化碳的人都需要立即呼吸新鲜空气并就医。对于昏迷或无法回应的人，请致电紧急医疗服务 (EMS) 或立即拨打 911。
desc_en: Carbon monoxide poisoning occurs when carbon monoxide builds up in the blood. When too much carbon monoxide is in the air, the body replaces the oxygen in the red blood cells with carbon monoxide. This can lead to serious tissue damage, or even death.Carbon monoxide is gas that has no odor, taste or color. Burning fuels, including gas, wood, propane or charcoal, make carbon monoxide. Appliances and engines that aren't well vented can cause the gas to build up to dangerous levels. A tightly enclosed space makes the buildup worse.Anyone exposed to carbon monoxide needs to get into fresh air and seek medical care right away. Call emergency medical services (EMS) or dial 911 right away for someone who's in a coma or can't respond.

title: 类癌肿瘤
desc: 类癌是一种生长缓慢的癌症，可能出现在全身多个部位。类癌肿瘤是神经内分泌肿瘤的一种，通常始于消化道（胃、阑尾、小肠、结肠、直肠）或肺部。类癌肿瘤通常直到晚期才会引起体征和症状。疾病。类癌肿瘤可以产生并向体内释放激素，从而引起腹泻或皮肤潮红等体征和症状。类癌肿瘤的治疗通常包括手术，也可能包括药物治疗。
type: Surgical Oncology and Endocrine Surgery in Arizona
desc_en: Carcinoid tumors are a type of slow-growing cancer that can arise in several places throughout your body. Carcinoid tumors, which are one subset of tumors called neuroendocrine tumors, usually begin in the digestive tract (stomach, appendix, small intestine, colon, rectum) or in the lungs.Carcinoid tumors often don't cause signs and symptoms until late in the disease. Carcinoid tumors can produce and release hormones into your body that cause signs and symptoms such as diarrhea or skin flushing.Treatment for carcinoid tumors usually includes surgery and may include medications.

title: 心源性休克
desc: 原发性不明癌是当医生无法确定癌症起始部位时做出的诊断。最常见的是，当医生发现癌症起始部位（原发性肿瘤）时，就会诊断出癌症。如果癌症已经扩散（转移），这些部位也可能被发现。在原发不明的癌症，也称为隐匿性原发性癌症中，医生发现了在体内扩散的癌细胞，但找不到原发性肿瘤.医生在选择最合适的治疗方法时会考虑原发肿瘤的位置。因此，如果发现原发灶不明的癌症，医生会努力确定原发肿瘤部位。在尝试确定您的癌症起源时，您的医生可能会考虑您的风险因素、症状以及检查、影像学检查和病理学检查的结果。
desc_en: Carcinoma of unknown primary is a diagnosis given when doctors aren't able to locate where a cancer began.Most often, cancer is diagnosed when doctors discover the spot where the cancer began (primary tumor). If the cancer has spread (metastasized), those sites might be discovered, too.In carcinoma of unknown primary, also known as occult primary cancer, doctors find the cancer cells that spread in the body, but they can't find the primary tumor.Doctors consider the location of the primary tumor when choosing the most appropriate treatments. So if carcinoma of unknown primary is found, doctors work to try to identify the primary tumor site. Your doctor might consider your risk factors, symptoms, and results from exams, imaging tests and pathology tests when trying to determine where your cancer began.

title: 心肌病
desc: 心肌病 (kahr-dee-o-my-OP-uh-thee) 是一种心肌疾病，会导致心脏更难将血液泵送到身体其他部位。心肌病可导致心力衰竭。心肌病的主要类型包括扩张型、肥厚型和限制型心肌病。治疗——可能包括药物、手术植入装置、心脏手术，或者在严重的情况下进行心脏移植——取决于心肌病的类型和严重程度。
desc_en: Cardiomyopathy (kahr-dee-o-my-OP-uh-thee) is a disease of the heart muscle that makes it harder for the heart to pump blood to the rest of the body. Cardiomyopathy can lead to heart failure.The main types of cardiomyopathy include dilated, hypertrophic and restrictive cardiomyopathy. Treatment — which might include medications, surgically implanted devices, heart surgery or, in severe cases, a heart transplant — depends on the type of cardiomyopathy and how serious it is.

title: 腕管综合症
desc: 腕管综合症是最常见的手部疾病之一。它是由手腕腕管内的正中神经受压引起的。腕管是手掌侧由骨头和韧带包围的狭窄通道。当正中神经受压时，症状可能包括拇指和手指麻木、刺痛和无力。手腕解剖结构、健康状况以及可能重复的手部动作可能会导致腕管综合症。正确的治疗通常可以缓解刺痛和麻木并恢复手部功能。
type: Trauma, Critical Care and General Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Carpal tunnel syndrome is one of the most common hand conditions. It is caused by pressure on the median nerve in the carpal tunnel of the wrist. The carpal tunnel is a narrow passageway surrounded by bones and ligaments on the palm side of the hand. When the median nerve is compressed, symptoms can include numbness, tingling and weakness in the thumb and fingers.Wrist anatomy, health conditions and possibly repetitive hand motions can contribute to carpal tunnel syndrome.Proper treatment usually relieves the tingling and numbness and restores hand function.

title: 卡斯尔曼病
desc: 卡斯尔曼病是一种罕见的疾病，涉及身体淋巴结细胞过度生长。该疾病最常见的形式影响单个淋巴结，通常位于胸部或腹部。这种形式称为单中心 Castleman 病。多中心 Castleman 病 (MCD) 影响全身多个淋巴结。有 3 种类型：治疗和前景会有所不同，具体取决于您所患的卡斯尔曼病的类型。仅影响一个淋巴结的类型，即单中心卡斯尔曼病，通常可以通过手术成功治疗。
desc_en: Castleman disease is a rare disorder that involves an overgrowth of cells in your body's lymph nodes. The most common form of the disorder affects a single lymph node, usually in the chest or abdomen. This form is called unicentric Castleman disease.Multicentric Castleman disease, or MCD, affects multiple lymph nodes throughout the body. There are 3 types:Treatment and outlook vary, depending on the type of Castleman disease you have. The type that affects only one lymph node, unicentric Castleman disease, can usually be successfully treated with surgery.

title: 蛀牙/蛀牙
desc: 蛀牙是牙齿坚硬表面受损的区域。这些蛀牙区域会变成微小的开口或孔洞，可能导致严重的牙痛、感染和牙齿脱落。导致蛀牙的原因有多种，包括口腔中的细菌、吃太多零食、喝含糖饮料以及没有很好地清洁牙齿。蛀牙和蛀牙是世界上最常见的健康问题之一。它们在儿童、青少年和老年人中尤其常见。但任何有牙齿的人都可能患有蛀牙，包括婴​​儿。如果蛀牙不得到治疗，它们会变得更大并影响牙齿的更深层次。定期看牙医以及良好的刷牙和使用牙线的习惯是保护牙齿免受蛀牙的最佳方法。
desc_en: Cavities are areas in the hard surface of your teeth that are damaged. These areas of tooth decay become tiny openings or holes that can lead to a serious toothache, infection and tooth loss. There are several causes of cavities, including bacteria in your mouth, snacking a lot, sipping sugary drinks and not cleaning your teeth well.Cavities and tooth decay are among the world's most common health problems. They're especially common in children, teenagers and older adults. But anyone who has teeth can get cavities, including babies.If cavities aren't treated, they get larger and affect deeper layers of your teeth. Regular dental visits and good brushing and flossing habits are the best ways to protect your teeth from cavities.

title: 乳糜泻
desc: 乳糜泻是一种由对食用麸质的免疫反应引起的疾病。麸质是一种存在于含有小麦、大麦或黑麦的食物中的蛋白质。如果您患有乳糜泻，食用麸质会引发小肠中针对麸质蛋白的免疫反应。随着时间的推移，这种反应会损害小肠内壁并阻止其吸收营养，这种情况称为吸收不良。肠道损伤通常会导致腹泻、疲劳、体重减轻、腹胀或贫血等症状。如果不加以管理或治疗，它还可能导致严重的并发症。对于儿童来说，除了胃肠道症状外，吸收不良还会影响生长和发育。乳糜泻尚无明确的治愈方法。但对于大多数人来说，遵循严格的无麸质饮食可以帮助控制症状并帮助肠道愈合。
desc_en: Celiac disease is an illness caused by an immune reaction to eating gluten. Gluten is a protein found in foods containing wheat, barley or rye.If you have celiac disease, eating gluten triggers an immune response to the gluten protein in your small intestine. Over time, this reaction damages your small intestine's lining and prevents it from absorbing nutrients, a condition called malabsorption.The intestinal damage often causes symptoms such as diarrhea, fatigue, weight loss, bloating or anemia. It also can lead to serious complications if it is not managed or treated. In children, malabsorption can affect growth and development in addition to gastrointestinal symptoms.There's no definite cure for celiac disease. But for most people, following a strict gluten-free diet can help manage symptoms and help the intestines heal.

title: 橘皮组织
desc: 脂肪团是一种非常常见、无害的皮肤病，会导致大腿、臀部、臀部和腹部出现块状、凹陷的肌肉。这种情况在女性中最为普遍。许多人尝试通过减肥、锻炼、按摩和销售作为脂肪团解决方案销售的面霜来改善皮肤外观，并取得了不同程度的成功。也有经过医学证明的治疗方案，但效果不是立竿见影或持久的。
type: Center for Aesthetic Medicine & Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Cellulite is a very common, harmless skin condition that causes lumpy, dimpled flesh on the thighs, hips, buttocks and abdomen. The condition is most prevalent in women.Many people try, with variable success, to improve the appearance of their skin through weight loss, exercise, massage and creams marketed as a solution to cellulite. Medically proven treatment options are available as well, though results aren't immediate or long lasting.

title: 中枢神经系统血管畸形
desc: 蜂窝织炎 (sel-u-LIE-tis) 是一种常见的、可能严重的细菌性皮肤感染。受影响的皮肤肿胀、发炎，通常会疼痛且摸起来发热。蜂窝组织炎通常影响小腿，但也可能发生在面部、手臂和其他部位。当皮肤破损让细菌进入时就会发生感染。如果不及时治疗，感染可能会扩散到淋巴结和血液，并迅速危及生命。它通常不会在人与人之间传播。
desc_en: Cellulitis (sel-u-LIE-tis) is a common, potentially serious bacterial skin infection. The affected skin is swollen and inflamed and is typically painful and warm to the touch.Cellulitis usually affects the lower legs, but it can occur on the face, arms and other areas. The infection happens when a break in the skin allows bacteria to enter.Left untreated, the infection can spread to the lymph nodes and bloodstream and rapidly become life-threatening. It isn't usually spread from person to person.

title: 中枢性睡眠呼吸暂停
desc: 中枢性睡眠呼吸暂停是一种在睡眠期间呼吸反复停止和开始的疾病。中枢性睡眠呼吸暂停的发生是因为大脑没有向控制呼吸的肌肉发送适当的信号。这种情况与阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停不同，阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停是由于喉咙肌肉放松并阻塞气道而导致呼吸停止。中枢性睡眠呼吸暂停比阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停少见。中枢性睡眠呼吸暂停也可能由其他疾病引起，例如心力衰竭和中风。另一个可能的原因是在高海拔地区睡眠。中枢性睡眠呼吸暂停的治疗可能包括控制现有条件、使用辅助呼吸装置或使用补充氧气。
desc_en: Central sleep apnea is a disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts during sleep.Central sleep apnea occurs because the brain doesn't send proper signals to the muscles that control breathing. This condition is different from obstructive sleep apnea, in which breathing stops because the throat muscles relax and block the airway. Central sleep apnea is less common than obstructive sleep apnea.Central sleep apnea can result from other conditions, such as heart failure and stroke. Another possible cause is sleeping at a high altitude.Treatments for central sleep apnea might involve managing existing conditions, using a device to assist breathing or using supplemental oxygen.

title: 脑瘫
desc: 脑瘫是一组影响运动和姿势的疾病。它是由发育中的大脑受损引起的，最常见的是在出生前。症状出现在婴儿期或学龄前，症状从非常轻微到严重不等。患有脑瘫的儿童可能有过度的反射。手臂、腿和躯干可能显得松软。或者他们的肌肉可能僵硬，称为痉挛。症状还可能包括姿势不规则、动作无法控制、行走不稳定或这些症状的组合。脑瘫可能会导致吞咽困难。它还可能导致眼肌不平衡，即眼睛无法聚焦在同一物体上。患有这种疾病的人可能会因肌肉僵硬而减少关节的活动范围。脑瘫的原因及其对功能的影响因人而异。有些脑瘫患者可以行走，而其他人则需要帮助。有些人有智力障碍，但其他人则没有。癫痫、失明或耳聋也可能影响一些脑瘫患者。无法治愈，但治疗可以帮助改善功能。脑瘫的症状在孩子的发育过程中可能会有所不同，但病情不会恶化。随着时间的推移，这种情况通常保持不变。
desc_en: Cerebral palsy is a group of conditions that affect movement and posture. It's caused by damage that occurs to the developing brain, most often before birth.Symptoms appear during infancy or preschool years and vary from very mild to serious Children with cerebral palsy may have exaggerated reflexes. The arms, legs and trunk may appear floppy. Or they may have stiff muscles, known as spasticity. Symptoms also can include irregular posture, movements that can't be controlled, a walk that's not steady or some combination of these.Cerebral palsy may make it hard to swallow. It also can cause eye muscle imbalance, in which the eyes don't focus on the same object. People with the condition might have reduced range of motion in their joints due to muscle stiffness.The cause of cerebral palsy and its effect on function vary from person to person. Some people with cerebral palsy can walk while others need assistance. Some people have intellectual disabilities, but others do not. Epilepsy, blindness or deafness also might affect some people with cerebral palsy. There is no cure, but treatments can help improve function. The symptoms of cerebral palsy may vary during the child's development, but the condition doesn't get worse. The condition generally stays the same over time.

title: 宫颈癌
desc: 宫颈癌是从子宫​​颈开始的细胞生长。子宫颈是连接阴道的子宫下部。人乳头瘤病毒（也称为 HPV）的各种毒株在引起大多数宫颈癌方面发挥着作用。 HPV 是一种通过性接触传播的常见感染。当接触 HPV 时，人体的免疫系统通常会阻止病毒造成伤害。然而，在一小部分人中，病毒可以存活数年。这有助于导致一些宫颈细胞变成癌细胞的过程。您可以通过筛查测试和接种预防 HPV 感染的疫苗来降低患宫颈癌的风险。发生宫颈癌时，通常首先需要进行手术切除癌症。其他治疗方法可能包括杀死癌细胞的药物。选择可能包括化疗和靶向治疗药物。也可以使用强能量束的放射治疗。有时治疗结合放疗和低剂量化疗。
desc_en: Cervical cancer is a growth of cells that starts in the cervix. The cervix is the lower part of the uterus that connects to the vagina.Various strains of the human papillomavirus, also called HPV, play a role in causing most cervical cancers. HPV is a common infection that's passed through sexual contact. When exposed to HPV, the body's immune system typically prevents the virus from doing harm. In a small percentage of people, however, the virus survives for years. This contributes to the process that causes some cervical cells to become cancer cells. You can reduce your risk of developing cervical cancer by having screening tests and receiving a vaccine that protects against HPV infection.When cervical cancer happens, it's often first treated with surgery to remove the cancer. Other treatments may include medicines to kill the cancer cells. Options might include chemotherapy and targeted therapy medicines. Radiation therapy with powerful energy beams also may be used. Sometimes treatment combines radiation with low-dose chemotherapy.

title: 宫颈炎
desc: 宫颈炎是子宫颈的炎症，子宫颈是子宫下端狭窄的开口，通向阴道。宫颈炎的可能症状包括月经期间出血、性交或盆腔检查时疼痛以及阴道分泌物异常。然而，也有可能患有宫颈炎但没有任何体征或症状。宫颈炎通常是由性传播感染引起的，例如衣原体或淋病。非感染性原因也可能导致宫颈炎。宫颈炎的成功治疗涉及治疗炎症的根本原因。
desc_en: Cervicitis is an inflammation of the cervix, the lower, narrow end of the uterus that opens into the vagina.Possible symptoms of cervicitis include bleeding between menstrual periods, pain with intercourse or during a pelvic exam, and abnormal vaginal discharge. However, it's also possible to have cervicitis and not experience any signs or symptoms.Often, cervicitis results from a sexually transmitted infection, such as chlamydia or gonorrhea. Cervicitis can develop from noninfectious causes, too. Successful treatment of cervicitis involves treating the underlying cause of the inflammation.

title: Chiari畸形
desc: Chiari 畸形（kee-AH-ree mal-for-MAY-shun）是一种脑组织延伸到椎管内的疾病。当头骨的一部分畸形或小于典型头骨时，就会发生这种情况。颅骨压迫大脑并迫使其向下。Chiari 畸形并不常见，但影像学检查的使用增加导致了更多的诊断。医疗保健专业人员将 Chiari 畸形分为三种类型。类型取决于被推入椎管的脑组织的解剖结构。类型还取决于大脑或脊柱是否存在发育变化。Chiari 畸形 1 型随着颅骨和大脑的生长而发展。症状可能要到童年晚期或成年才会出现。 Chiari 畸形的儿童形式为 2 型和 3 型。这些类型在出生时就存在，称为先天性。Chiari 畸形的治疗取决于类型和症状。定期监测、药物和手术是治疗选择。有时不需要治疗。
type: Cerebrospinal Fluid Dynamics Clinic in Florida
desc_en: Chiari malformation (kee-AH-ree mal-for-MAY-shun) is a condition in which brain tissue extends into the spinal canal. It occurs when part of the skull is misshapen or smaller than is typical. The skull presses on the brain and forces it downward.Chiari malformation is not common, but increased use of imaging tests has led to more diagnoses.Health care professionals group Chiari malformation into three types. The type depends on the anatomy of the brain tissue that is pushed into the spinal canal. The type also depends on whether there are developmental changes of the brain or spine.Chiari malformation type 1 develops as the skull and brain are growing. Symptoms may not occur until late childhood or adulthood. The pediatric forms of Chiari malformation are type 2 and type 3. These types are present at birth, which is known as congenital.Treatment of Chiari malformation depends on the type and the symptoms. Regular monitoring, medicines and surgery are treatment options. Sometimes no treatment is needed.

title: 水痘
desc: 水痘是由水痘带状疱疹病毒引起的疾病。它会引起发痒的皮疹，并伴有充满液体的小水泡。水痘很容易传播给未患过该病或未接种水痘疫苗的人。水痘曾经是一个普遍存在的问题，但如今疫苗可以保护儿童免受水痘的侵害。水痘疫苗是预防这种疾病以及在此期间可能发生的其他健康问题的安全方法。
desc_en: Chickenpox is an illness caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It brings on an itchy rash with small, fluid-filled blisters. Chickenpox spreads very easily to people who haven't had the disease or haven't gotten the chickenpox vaccine. Chickenpox used to be a widespread problem, but today the vaccine protects children from it.The chickenpox vaccine is a safe way to prevent this illness and the other health problems that can happen during it.

title: 童年言语失用症
desc: 儿童言语失用症（CAS）是一种罕见的言语障碍。患有这种疾病的儿童在说话时难以控制嘴唇、下巴和舌头。在 CAS 中，大脑无法规划言语运动。大脑无法正确引导言语所需的运动。言语肌肉并不弱，但肌肉不能以正确的方式形成单词。为了正确说话，大脑必须制定计划，告诉言语肌肉如何移动嘴唇、下巴和舌头。这些动作通常会以适当的速度和节奏发出准确的声音和单词。 CAS 影响这一过程。CAS 通常通过言语治疗来治疗。在言语治疗过程中，言语病理学家会教孩子练习说出单词、音节和短语的正确方法。
desc_en: Childhood apraxia of speech (CAS) is a rare speech disorder. Children with this disorder have trouble controlling their lips, jaws and tongues when speaking.In CAS, the brain has trouble planning for speech movement. The brain isn't able to properly direct the movements needed for speech. The speech muscles aren't weak, but the muscles don't form words the right way.To speak correctly, the brain has to make plans that tell the speech muscles how to move the lips, jaw and tongue. The movements usually result in accurate sounds and words spoken at the proper speed and rhythm. CAS affects this process.CAS is often treated with speech therapy. During speech therapy, a speech-language pathologist teaches the child to practice the correct way to say words, syllables and phrases.

title: 儿童肥胖
desc: 儿童肥胖是一种影响儿童和青少年的严重疾病。这尤其令人不安，因为额外的体重常常会让儿童陷入曾经被认为是成人问题的健康问题——糖尿病、高血压和高胆固醇。儿童肥胖还会导致自尊心差和抑郁。减少儿童肥胖的最佳策略之一是改善整个家庭的饮食和运动习惯。治疗和预防儿童肥胖有助于保护孩子现在和未来的健康。
desc_en: Childhood obesity is a serious medical condition that affects children and adolescents. It's particularly troubling because the extra pounds often start children on the path to health problems that were once considered adult problems — diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol. Childhood obesity can also lead to poor self-esteem and depression.One of the best strategies to reduce childhood obesity is to improve the eating and exercise habits of your entire family. Treating and preventing childhood obesity helps protect your child's health now and in the future.

title: 童年精神分裂症
desc: 儿童精神分裂症是一种罕见但严重的精神障碍，儿童和青少年会异常地解释现实。精神分裂症涉及一系列思维（认知）、行为或情绪问题。它可能会导致幻觉、妄想以及极其混乱的思维和行为，从而损害孩子的功能。儿童精神分裂症本质上与成人精神分裂症相同，但它开始于生命早期——通常是在青少年时期——并且对孩子的行为和发展有着深远的影响。儿童精神分裂症的发病年龄较早，这给诊断、治疗、教育、情感和社会发展带来了特殊的挑战。精神分裂症是一种慢性疾病，需要终生治疗。尽早识别并开始治疗儿童精神分裂症可能会显着改善孩子的长期结果。
desc_en: Childhood schizophrenia is an uncommon but severe mental disorder in which children and teenagers interpret reality abnormally. Schizophrenia involves a range of problems with thinking (cognitive), behavior or emotions. It may result in some combination of hallucinations, delusions, and extremely disordered thinking and behavior that impairs your child's ability to function.Childhood schizophrenia is essentially the same as schizophrenia in adults, but it starts early in life — generally in the teenage years — and has a profound impact on a child's behavior and development. With childhood schizophrenia, the early age of onset presents special challenges for diagnosis, treatment, education, and emotional and social development.Schizophrenia is a chronic condition that requires lifelong treatment. Identifying and starting treatment for childhood schizophrenia as early as possible may significantly improve your child's long-term outcome.

title: 沙眼衣原体
desc: 衣原体 (kluh-MID-e-uh) 是一种常见的性传播感染 (STI)，也称为性传播疾病 (STD)。衣原体是由沙眼衣原体 (truh-KOH-muh-tis) 细菌引起的。您可能不知道自己患有衣原体，因为许多人没有症状，例如生殖器疼痛和阴道或阴茎有分泌物。沙眼衣原体主要影响年轻女性，但男性和女性以及所有年龄段的人都可能发生。治疗并不困难，但如果不及时治疗，可能会导致更严重的健康问题。
desc_en: Chlamydia (kluh-MID-e-uh) is a common sexually transmitted infection (STI), also known as a sexually transmitted disease (STD). Chlamydia is caused by Chlamydia trachomatis (truh-KOH-muh-tis) bacteria. You might not know you have chlamydia because many people don't have symptoms, such as genital pain and discharge from the vagina or penis.Chlamydia trachomatis affects mostly young women, but it can occur in both men and women and in all age groups. It's not difficult to treat, but if left untreated it can lead to more-serious health problems.

title: 胆管癌（胆管癌）
desc: 胆管癌是一种在携带消化液胆汁的细长管（胆管）中形成的癌症。胆管将肝脏与胆囊和小肠连接起来。胆管癌也称为胆管癌，尽管可以发生在任何年龄，但主要发生在 50 岁以上的人群中。医生根据胆管癌发生的部位将胆管癌分为不同类型。癌症发生在胆管中：胆管癌通常在晚期时才被诊断出来，因此很难实现成功的治疗。
desc_en: Cholangiocarcinoma is a type of cancer that forms in the slender tubes (bile ducts) that carry the digestive fluid bile. Bile ducts connect your liver to your gallbladder and to your small intestine.Cholangiocarcinoma, also known as bile duct cancer, occurs mostly in people older than age 50, though it can occur at any age.Doctors divide cholangiocarcinoma into different types based on where the cancer occurs in the bile ducts:Cholangiocarcinoma is often diagnosed when it's advanced, making successful treatment difficult to achieve.

title: 妊娠期胆汁淤积
desc: 妊娠期肝内胆汁淤积，俗称妊娠期胆汁淤积，是妊娠晚期可能发生的一种肝脏疾病。这种情况会引发剧烈瘙痒，但不会出现皮疹。瘙痒通常发生在手和脚上，但也可能发生在身体的其他部位。妊娠期胆汁淤积会让您感到非常不舒服。但更令人担忧的是潜在的并发症，尤其是对您的宝宝而言。由于存在并发症的风险，您的妊娠护理人员可能会建议在 37 周左右提前足月分娩。
desc_en: Intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy, commonly known as cholestasis of pregnancy, is a liver condition that can occur in late pregnancy. The condition triggers intense itching, but without a rash. Itching is usually on the hands and feet but also can occur on other parts of the body.Cholestasis of pregnancy can make you very uncomfortable. But more worrisome are the potential complications, especially for your baby. Because of the risk of complications, your pregnancy care provider may recommend early term delivery around 37 weeks.

title: 软骨肉瘤
desc: 软骨肉瘤是一种罕见的癌症，通常始于骨骼，但有时也可能发生在骨骼附近的软组织中。软骨肉瘤最常发生在骨盆、臀部和肩部。更罕见的是，它可能发生在脊柱的骨头中。大多数软骨肉瘤生长缓慢，最初可能不会引起许多体征和症状。一些罕见类型生长迅速，并且扩散到身体其他部位的风险很高，这可能使这些癌症难以治疗。软骨肉瘤的治疗通常需要手术。其他选择可能包括放射治疗和化疗。
type: Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Chondrosarcoma is a rare type of cancer that usually begins in the bones, but can sometimes occur in the soft tissue near bones. Chondrosarcoma happens most often in the pelvis, hip and shoulder. More rarely, it can happen in the bones of the spine.Most chondrosarcomas grow slowly and may not cause many signs and symptoms at first. Some rare types grow rapidly and have a high risk of spreading to other areas of the body, which can make these cancers difficult to treat.Chondrosarcoma treatment usually involves surgery. Other options might include radiation therapy and chemotherapy.

title: 慢性日常头痛
desc: 大多数人都会时不时地感到头痛。但如果您头痛的天数多于不头痛的天数，则可能患有慢性每日头痛。慢性每日头痛不是特定的头痛类型，而是包括多种头痛亚型。慢性是指头痛发生的频率和持续的时间。慢性日常头痛的持续性使其成为最严重的头痛病症之一。积极的初始治疗和稳定的长期治疗可能会减轻疼痛并减少头痛。
desc_en: Most people have headaches from time to time. But if you have a headache more days than not, you might have chronic daily headaches.Rather than a specific headache type, chronic daily headaches include a variety of headache subtypes. Chronic refers to how often the headaches occur and how long the condition lasts.The constant nature of chronic daily headaches makes them one of the most disabling headache conditions. Aggressive initial treatment and steady, long-term management might reduce pain and lead to fewer headaches.

title: 慢性肉芽肿病
desc: 慢性肉芽肿 (gran-u-LOM-uh-tus) 病 (CGD) 是一种遗传性疾病，当一种称为吞噬细胞的白细胞无法正常工作时就会发生这种疾病。吞噬细胞通常可以帮助您的身体抵抗感染。当吞噬细胞无法正常工作时，它们就无法保护您的身体免受细菌和真菌感染。患有慢性肉芽肿性疾病的人可能会在肺部、皮肤、淋巴结、肝脏、胃和肠道或其他部位发生感染。它们还可能在感染区域产生白细胞簇。大多数人在儿童时期被诊断出患有 CGD，但有些人可能直到成年才被诊断出来。
desc_en: Chronic granulomatous (gran-u-LOM-uh-tus) disease (CGD) is an inherited disorder that occurs when a type of white blood cell, called a phagocyte, doesn't work properly. Phagocytes usually help your body fight infections. When they don't work as they should, phagocytes can't protect your body from bacterial and fungal infections.People with chronic granulomatous disease may develop infections in their lungs, skin, lymph nodes, liver, stomach and intestines, or other areas. They also may develop clusters of white blood cells in infected areas. Most people are diagnosed with CGD during childhood, but some people may not be diagnosed until adulthood.

title: 慢性荨麻疹
desc: 荨麻疹 - 也称为荨麻疹 (ur-tih-KAR-e-uh) - 是一种引起瘙痒伤痕的皮肤反应。慢性荨麻疹是指持续六周以上的伤痕，通常在数月或数年内复发。通常，慢性荨麻疹的原因尚不清楚。伤痕通常以发痒的斑块开始，然后变成大小不等的肿胀伤痕。随着反应的进行，这些伤痕会随机出现和消失。慢性荨麻疹可能会非常不舒服，并会干扰睡眠和日常活动。对于许多人来说，止痒药物（抗组胺药）可以缓解疼痛。
desc_en: Hives — also called urticaria (ur-tih-KAR-e-uh) — is a skin reaction that causes itchy welts. Chronic hives are welts that last for more than six weeks and return often over months or years. Often, the cause of chronic hives isn't clear.The welts often start as itchy patches that turn into swollen welts that vary in size. These welts appear and fade at random as the reaction runs its course.Chronic hives can be very uncomfortable and interfere with sleep and daily activities. For many people, anti-itch medications (antihistamines) provide relief.

title: 慢性肾病
desc: 慢性肾病，也称为慢性肾衰竭，涉及肾功能逐渐丧失。您的肾脏过滤血液中的废物和多余液体，然后通过尿液排出。晚期慢性肾病可能会导致体内液体、电解质和废物堆积到危险水平。在慢性肾病的早期阶段，您可能没有什么体征或症状。在病情发展之前，您可能不会意识到自己患有肾脏疾病。慢性肾脏疾病的治疗重点是减缓肾脏损害的进展，通常是通过控制病因。但是，即使控制了病因也可能无法阻止肾脏损伤的进展。慢性肾病可进展为终末期肾衰竭，如果不进行人工过滤（透析）或肾移植，这种情况是致命的。
desc_en: Chronic kidney disease, also called chronic kidney failure, involves a gradual loss of kidney function. Your kidneys filter wastes and excess fluids from your blood, which are then removed in your urine. Advanced chronic kidney disease can cause dangerous levels of fluid, electrolytes and wastes to build up in your body.In the early stages of chronic kidney disease, you might have few signs or symptoms. You might not realize that you have kidney disease until the condition is advanced.Treatment for chronic kidney disease focuses on slowing the progression of kidney damage, usually by controlling the cause. But, even controlling the cause might not keep kidney damage from progressing. Chronic kidney disease can progress to end-stage kidney failure, which is fatal without artificial filtering (dialysis) or a kidney transplant.

title: 慢性淋巴细胞白血病
desc: 慢性淋巴细胞白血病 (CLL) 是一种血液和骨髓癌症，骨髓是骨骼内生成血细胞的海绵组织。慢性淋巴细胞白血病中的“慢性”一词来自这样一个事实，即这种白血病通常进展速度比慢性淋巴细胞白血病慢。其他类型的白血病。慢性淋巴细胞白血病中的“淋巴细胞”一词来自受该疾病影响的细胞，即一组称为淋巴细胞的白细胞，可帮助您的身体抵抗感染。慢性淋巴细胞白血病最常影响老年人。有一些治疗方法可以帮助控制这种疾病。
desc_en: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) is a type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow — the spongy tissue inside bones where blood cells are made.The term "chronic" in chronic lymphocytic leukemia comes from the fact that this leukemia typically progresses more slowly than other types of leukemia. The term "lymphocytic" in chronic lymphocytic leukemia comes from the cells affected by the disease — a group of white blood cells called lymphocytes, which help your body fight infection.Chronic lymphocytic leukemia most commonly affects older adults. There are treatments to help control the disease.

title: 慢性粒细胞白血病
desc: 慢性粒细胞白血病，也称为 CML，是一种罕见的骨髓癌症。骨髓是骨骼内产生血细胞的海绵组织。 CML 会导致血液中白细胞数量增加。慢性粒细胞白血病中的“慢性”一词意味着这种癌症往往比严重形式的白血病进展得更慢。术语“骨髓性”(my-uh-LOHJ-uh-nus) 是指受这种癌症影响的细胞类型。慢性粒细胞白血病也可称为慢性粒细胞白血病和慢性粒细胞白血病。它通常影响老年人，很少发生在儿童中，但它可以发生在任何年龄。治疗的进步改善了慢性粒细胞白血病患者的预后。大多数人在诊断后可以获得缓解并存活多年。
desc_en: Chronic myelogenous leukemia, also called CML, is an uncommon type of cancer of the bone marrow. Bone marrow is the spongy tissue inside bones where blood cells are made. CML causes an increased number of white blood cells in the blood.The term "chronic" in chronic myelogenous leukemia means this cancer tends to progress more slowly than severe forms of leukemia. The term "myelogenous" (my-uh-LOHJ-uh-nus) refers to the type of cells affected by this cancer.Chronic myelogenous leukemia also can be called chronic myeloid leukemia and chronic granulocytic leukemia. It typically affects older adults and rarely occurs in children, though it can occur at any age.Advances in treatment have improved the prognosis of people with chronic myelogenous leukemia. Most people can achieve remission and live for many years after diagnosis.

title: 慢性鼻窦炎
desc: 慢性鼻窦炎会导致鼻子和头部内部的空间（称为鼻窦）发炎和肿胀。即使经过治疗，这种情况也会持续 12 周或更长时间。这种常见情况会导致粘液无法排出。它使鼻子不通气。通过鼻子呼吸可能会很困难。眼睛周围的区域可能会感觉肿胀或压痛。感染、鼻窦内的生长（称为鼻息肉）以及鼻窦内壁肿胀都可能是慢性鼻窦炎的一部分。慢性鼻窦炎也称为慢性鼻窦炎。这种情况影响成人和儿童。
desc_en: Chronic sinusitis causes the spaces inside the nose and head, called sinuses, to become inflamed and swollen. The condition lasts 12 weeks or longer, even with treatment.This common condition keeps mucus from draining. It makes the nose stuffy. Breathing through the nose might be hard. The area around the eyes might feel swollen or tender.Infection, growths in the sinuses, called nasal polyps, and swelling of the lining of the sinuses might all be part of chronic sinusitis. Chronic sinusitis is also called chronic rhinosinusitis. The condition affects adults and children.

title: 慢性创伤性脑病
desc: 慢性创伤性脑病 (CTE) 是一种可能由反复头部受伤引起的脑部疾病。它会导致大脑中神经细胞的死亡，称为退化。随着时间的推移，CTE 会变得更糟。明确诊断 CTE 的唯一方法是在死后进行大脑尸检。CTE 是一种尚未被充分了解的罕见疾病。 CTE 似乎与单一头部损伤无关。它与反复头部受伤有关，通常发生在接触运动或军事战斗中。 CTE 的发展与二次撞击综合症有关，即在先前的头部受伤症状完全解决之前发生第二次头部受伤。专家们仍在试图了解反复的头部受伤和其他因素如何导致大脑发生变化，从而导致大脑损伤。导致 CTE。研究人员正在研究一个人经历的头部受伤次数以及受伤的严重程度如何影响 CTE 的风险。在参加美式橄榄球和其他接触运动（包括拳击）的人的大脑中发现了 CTE。暴露于爆炸性爆炸的军事人员也可能发生这种情况。 CTE 的症状被认为包括思维和情绪障碍、身体问题和其他行为。据认为，这些疾病会在头部外伤发生数年至数十年后发生。除非存在高风险暴露的人群，否则在一生中无法明确诊断 CTE。研究人员目前正在开发 CTE 的诊断生物标志物，但尚未得到验证。当出现与 CTE 相关的症状时，医疗保健提供者可能会诊断为创伤性脑病综合征。专家尚不清楚 CTE 在人群中发生的频率，但似乎很少见。他们也不完全理解其中的原因。 CTE 无法治愈。
desc_en: Chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) is a brain disorder likely caused by repeated head injuries. It causes the death of nerve cells in the brain, known as degeneration. CTE gets worse over time. The only way to definitively diagnosis CTE is after death during an autopsy of the brain.CTE is a rare disorder that is not yet well understood. CTE doesn't appear to be related to a single head injury. It's related to repeated head injuries, often occurring in contact sports or military combat. The development of CTE has been associated with second impact syndrome, in which a second head injury happens before previous head injury symptoms have fully resolved.Experts are still trying to understand how repeated head injuries and other factors might contribute to the changes in the brain that result in CTE. Researchers are looking into how the number of head injuries someone experiences and how bad the injuries are may affect risk of CTE.CTE has been found in the brains of people who played U.S. football and other contact sports, including boxing. It also may occur in military members who were exposed to explosive blasts. Symptoms of CTE are thought to include trouble with thinking and emotions, physical problems, and other behaviors. It's thought that these develop years to decades after head trauma occurs.CTE can't be definitively diagnosed during life except in people with high-risk exposures. Researchers are currently developing diagnostic biomarkers for CTE, but none has been validated yet. When the symptoms associated with CTE occur, health care providers may diagnose traumatic encephalopathy syndrome.Experts don't yet know how often CTE occurs in the population, but it appears to be rare. They also don't fully understand the causes. There is no cure for CTE.

title: 马蹄内翻足
desc: 马蹄内翻足是指通常在出生时出现的一系列足部异常（先天性），即宝宝的足部扭曲变形或位置变形。在马蹄内翻足中，连接肌肉和骨骼（肌腱）的组织比平时短。马蹄内翻足是一种相当常见的出生缺陷，对于健康的新生儿来说通常是一个孤立的问题。马蹄内翻足可以是轻微的，也可以是严重的。大约一半的马蹄足儿童双脚都有马蹄足。如果您的孩子患有马蹄内翻足，正常行走会变得更加困难，因此医生通常建议在出生后立即进行治疗。医生通常无需手术即可成功治疗马蹄内翻足，但有时孩子需要在以后进行后续手术。
desc_en: Clubfoot describes a range of foot abnormalities usually present at birth (congenital) in which your baby's foot is twisted out of shape or position. In clubfoot, the tissues connecting the muscles to the bone (tendons) are shorter than usual. Clubfoot is a fairly common birth defect and is usually an isolated problem for an otherwise healthy newborn.Clubfoot can be mild or severe. About half of children with clubfoot have it in both feet. If your child has clubfoot, it will make it harder to walk normally, so doctors generally recommend treating it soon after birth.Doctors are usually able to treat clubfoot successfully without surgery, though sometimes children need follow-up surgery later on.

title: 寒冷性荨麻疹
desc: 寒冷性荨麻疹 (ur-tih-KAR-e-uh) 是一种皮肤对寒冷的反应，在寒冷暴露后几分钟内出现。受影响的皮肤会出现发痒的伤痕（荨麻疹）。患有寒冷性荨麻疹的人会出现各种不同的症状。有些人对寒冷的反应较轻，而另一些人则有严重的反应。对于一些患有这种疾病的人来说，在冷水中游泳可能会导致血压极低、昏厥或休克。寒冷性荨麻疹最常见于年轻人。如果您认为自己有这种情况，请咨询您的医生。治疗通常包括预防措施，例如服用抗组胺药和避免冷空气和水。
desc_en: Cold urticaria (ur-tih-KAR-e-uh) is a skin reaction to cold that appears within minutes after cold exposure. Affected skin develops itchy welts (hives).People with cold urticaria experience widely different symptoms. Some have minor reactions to the cold, while others have severe reactions. For some people with this condition, swimming in cold water could lead to very low blood pressure, fainting or shock.Cold urticaria occurs most frequently in young adults. If you think you have this condition, consult your doctor. Treatment usually includes preventive steps such as taking antihistamines and avoiding cold air and water.

title: 结肠癌
desc: 结肠癌是从大肠称为结肠的部分开始的细胞生长。结肠是大肠的第一个也是最长的部分。大肠是消化系统的最后一部分。消化系统分解食物供身体使用。结肠癌通常影响老年人，但任何年龄都可能发生。它通常始于结肠内形成的称为息肉的小细胞团。息肉通常不会癌变，但随着时间的推移，有些可能会变成结肠癌。息肉通常不会引起症状。因此，医生建议定期进行筛查以寻找结肠息肉。发现并切除息肉有助于预防结肠癌。如果发生结肠癌，许多治疗方法可以帮助控制它。治疗方法包括手术、放射治疗和药物治疗，例如化疗、靶向治疗和免疫治疗。结肠癌有时也称为结直肠癌。该术语结合了结肠癌和直肠癌，始于直肠。
desc_en: Colon cancer is a growth of cells that begins in a part of the large intestine called the colon. The colon is the first and longest part of the large intestine. The large intestine is the last part of the digestive system. The digestive system breaks down food for the body to use.Colon cancer typically affects older adults, though it can happen at any age. It usually begins as small clumps of cells called polyps that form inside the colon. Polyps generally aren't cancerous, but some can turn into colon cancers over time.Polyps often don't cause symptoms. For this reason, doctors recommend regular screening tests to look for polyps in the colon. Finding and removing polyps helps prevent colon cancer.If colon cancer develops, many treatments can help control it. Treatments include surgery, radiation therapy and medicines, such as chemotherapy, targeted therapy and immunotherapy.Colon cancer is sometimes called colorectal cancer. This term combines colon cancer and rectal cancer, which begins in the rectum.

title: 结肠息肉
desc: 结肠息肉是在结肠内壁上形成的一小块细胞。大多数结肠息肉是无害的。但随着时间的推移，一些结肠息肉可能会发展成结肠癌。结肠癌在晚期发现时可能是致命的。任何人都可能患上结肠息肉。如果您年满 50 岁、超重或吸烟，您面临的风险就会更高。如果您有结肠息肉或结肠癌的个人史或家族史，您的风险也会更高。结肠息肉通常不会引起症状。定期进行筛查测试很重要，因为早期发现的结肠息肉通常可以安全、彻底地切除。结肠癌的最佳预防方法是定期筛查和切除息肉。
desc_en: A colon polyp is a small clump of cells that forms on the lining of the colon. Most colon polyps are harmless. But over time, some colon polyps can develop into colon cancer. Colon cancer can be fatal when found in its later stages.Anyone can develop colon polyps. You're at higher risk if you are 50 or older, are overweight or are a smoker. You're also at higher risk if you have a personal or family history of colon polyps or colon cancer.Colon polyps don't usually cause symptoms. It's important to have regular screening tests because colon polyps found in the early stages can usually be removed safely and completely. The best prevention for colon cancer is regular screening for and removal of polyps.

title: 色盲
desc: 色盲——或者更准确地说，色觉较差或不足——是指无法看到某些颜色之间的差异。尽管许多人通常用“色盲”一词来形容这种情况，但真正的色盲（所有事物都以黑白色调看到）很少见。色盲通常是遗传性的。男性更有可能天生患有色盲。大多数色盲患者无法区分某些深浅的红色和绿色。不太常见的是，色盲患者无法区分蓝色和黄色的深浅。某些眼部疾病和某些药物也会导致色盲。
desc_en: Color blindness — or more accurately, poor or deficient color vision — is an inability to see the difference between certain colors. Though many people commonly use the term "color blind" for this condition, true color blindness — in which everything is seen in shades of black and white — is rare.Color blindness is usually inherited. Men are more likely to be born with color blindness. Most people with color blindness can't distinguish between certain shades of red and green. Less commonly, people with color blindness can't distinguish between shades of blue and yellow.Certain eye diseases and some medications also can cause color blindness.

title: 普通感冒
desc: 普通感冒是一种影响鼻子和喉咙的疾病。大多数情况下，它是无害的，但感觉可能并非如此。称为病毒的细菌会引起普通感冒。通常，成年人每年可能会患两次或三次感冒。婴幼儿可能更容易患感冒。大多数人的普通感冒会在 7 至 10 天内康复。吸烟者的症状可能持续更长时间。大多数情况下，普通感冒不需要医疗护理。如果症状没有好转或变得更糟，请咨询您的医疗保健提供者。由细菌引起的鼻子和喉咙疾病称为上呼吸道感染。
desc_en: The common cold is an illness affecting your nose and throat. Most often, it's harmless, but it might not feel that way. Germs called viruses cause a common cold.Often, adults may have two or three colds each year. Infants and young children may have colds more often.Most people recover from a common cold in 7 to 10 days. Symptoms might last longer in people who smoke. Most often, you don't need medical care for a common cold. If symptoms don't get better or if they get worse, see your health care provider.Illnesses of the nose and throat caused by germs are called upper respiratory tract infections.

title: 寻常疣
desc: 寻常疣是一种小的、粒状的皮肤生长物，最常出现在手指或手上。寻常疣摸起来很粗糙，通常还具有微小的黑点图案，这些小黑点是小的、凝结的血管。寻常疣是由病毒引起的，通过触摸传播。皮肤接触病毒后，疣可能需要长达两到六个月的时间才能形成。寻常疣通常是无害的，最终会自行消失。但许多人选择删除它们，因为他们觉得它们很麻烦或令人尴尬。
desc_en: Common warts are small, grainy skin growths that occur most often on your fingers or hands. Rough to the touch, common warts also often feature a pattern of tiny black dots, which are small, clotted blood vessels.Common warts are caused by a virus and are transmitted by touch. It can take a wart as long as two to six months to develop after your skin has been exposed to the virus. Common warts are usually harmless and eventually disappear on their own. But many people choose to remove them because they find them bothersome or embarrassing.

title: 复杂的悲伤
desc: 失去亲人是人们面临的最令人痛苦、不幸的是最常见的经历之一。大多数经历正常悲伤和丧亲之痛的人都会经历一段悲伤、麻木、甚至内疚和愤怒的时期。逐渐地，这些感觉会减轻，并且可以接受损失并继续前进。对于某些人来说，损失的感觉会让人衰弱，即使随着时间的推移也不会改善。这被称为复杂悲伤，有时称为持续性复杂丧亲障碍。在复杂的悲伤中，痛苦的情绪是如此持久和严重，以至于你很难从损失中恢复并恢复自己的生活。不同的人在悲伤经历中会走不同的路。这些阶段的顺序和时间可能因人而异：这些差异是正常的。但如果您在亲人去世一年多后仍无法度过这些阶段，您可能会感到复杂的悲伤。如果是这样，请寻求治疗。它可以帮助您接受损失并重新获得接受感和平静感。
desc_en: Losing a loved one is one of the most distressing and, unfortunately, common experiences people face. Most people experiencing normal grief and bereavement have a period of sorrow, numbness, and even guilt and anger. Gradually these feelings ease, and it's possible to accept loss and move forward.For some people, feelings of loss are debilitating and don't improve even after time passes. This is known as complicated grief, sometimes called persistent complex bereavement disorder. In complicated grief, painful emotions are so long lasting and severe that you have trouble recovering from the loss and resuming your own life.Different people follow different paths through the grieving experience. The order and timing of these phases may vary from person to person:These differences are normal. But if you're unable to move through these stages more than a year after the death of a loved one, you may have complicated grief. If so, seek treatment. It can help you come to terms with your loss and reclaim a sense of acceptance and peace.

title: 脑震荡
desc: 脑震荡是一种影响大脑功能的轻度创伤性脑损伤。影响通常是短期的，可能包括头痛以及注意力、记忆力、平衡、情绪和睡眠方面的问题。脑震荡通常是由与大脑功能变化相关的头部或身体撞击引起的。并非每个身体或头部受到打击的人都会发生脑震荡。有些脑震荡会导致人失去知觉，但大多数不会。跌倒是脑震荡的最常见原因。脑震荡在参加美式橄榄球或足球等接触性运动的运动员中也很常见。大多数人脑震荡后都会完全康复。
desc_en: A concussion is a mild traumatic brain injury that affects brain function. Effects are often short term and can include headaches and trouble with concentration, memory, balance, mood and sleep.Concussions usually are caused by an impact to the head or body that is associated with a change in brain function. Not everyone who experiences a blow to the body or head has a concussion.Some concussions cause the person to lose consciousness, but most do not.Falls are the most common cause of concussions. Concussions also are common among athletes who play a contact sport, such as American football or soccer. Most people recover fully after a concussion.

title: 先天性肾上腺皮质增生症
desc: 先天性肾上腺增生症（CAH）是指一组影响肾上腺的遗传性疾病，肾上腺是肾脏上方的一对核桃大小的器官。肾上腺产生重要的激素，包括：在患有 CAH 的人中，基因改变（突变）导致缺乏制造这些激素所需的一种酶。先天性肾上腺增生的两种主要类型是：尽管没有通过适当的治疗，大多数患有 CAH 的人都可以治愈。可以过上充实的生活。
desc_en: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) refers to a group of genetic disorders that affect the adrenal glands, a pair of walnut-sized organs above the kidneys. The adrenal glands produce important hormones, including:In people who have CAH, a gene change (mutation) results in a lack of one of the enzymes needed to make these hormones.The two major types of congenital adrenal hyperplasia are:Although there is no cure, with proper treatment, most people who have CAH. can lead full lives.

title: 成人先天性心脏病
desc: 先天性心脏病是自出生以来就存在的一种或多种心脏结构问题。先天性意味着您出生时就患有这种疾病。成人和儿童的先天性心脏病可以改变血液流经心脏的方式。先天性心脏病有许多不同类型。本文重点关注成人先天性心脏病。某些类型的先天性心脏病可能是轻微的。但复杂的缺陷可能会导致危及生命的并发症。然而，诊断和治疗的进步不断提高先天性心脏病患者的生存率。先天性心脏病患者需要终身医疗护理。治疗可能包括定期检查（观察等待）、药物或手术。如果您患有成人先天性心脏病，请询问您的医疗保健提供者您需要多久进行一次检查。
desc_en: Congenital heart disease is one or more problems with the heart's structure that exist since birth. Congenital means that you're born with the condition. Congenital heart disease in adults and children can change the way blood flows through the heart.There are many different types of congenital heart defects.
