desc: 溢乳（guh-lack-toe-REE-uh）是一种乳汁状溢液，与母乳喂养的正常产奶量无关。溢乳本身并不是一种疾病，但它可能是潜在问题的征兆。它通常发生在女性身上，甚至是那些从未生育过或绝经后的女性。但溢乳也可能发生在男性甚至婴儿身上。过度的乳房刺激、药物副作用或脑下垂体疾病都可能导致溢乳。通常，溢乳是由催乳素水平升高引起的，催乳素是一种刺激乳汁分泌的激素。有时，溢乳的原因无法确定。这种情况可能会自行解决。
desc_en: Galactorrhea (guh-lack-toe-REE-uh) is a milky nipple discharge unrelated to the normal milk production of breast-feeding. Galactorrhea itself isn't a disease, but it could be a sign of an underlying problem. It usually occurs in women, even those who have never had children or after menopause. But galactorrhea can happen in men and even in infants.Excessive breast stimulation, medication side effects or disorders of the pituitary gland all may contribute to galactorrhea. Often, galactorrhea results from increased levels of prolactin, the hormone that stimulates milk production.Sometimes, the cause of galactorrhea can't be determined. The condition may resolve on its own.

title: 胆囊癌
desc: 胆囊癌是一种始于胆囊的细胞异常生长。胆囊是一个小的梨形器官，位于腹部右侧，肝脏下方。胆囊储存胆汁，胆汁是肝脏产生的消化液。胆囊癌并不常见。当胆囊癌在最早阶段被发现时，治愈的机会就很大。但大多数胆囊癌都是在晚期才发现的，此时预后往往很差。胆囊癌可能直到晚期才被发现，因为它通常不会引起特定的体征或症状。此外，胆囊相对隐蔽的性质使得胆囊癌更容易在不被发现的情况下生长。
type: Early Onset and Hereditary GI Cancers Program
Surgical Oncology and Endocrine Surgery in Arizona
desc_en: Gallbladder cancer is an abnormal growth of cells that begins in the gallbladder.Your gallbladder is a small, pear-shaped organ on the right side of your abdomen, just beneath your liver. The gallbladder stores bile, a digestive fluid produced by your liver.Gallbladder cancer is uncommon. When gallbladder cancer is discovered at its earliest stages, the chance for a cure is very good. But most gallbladder cancers are discovered at a late stage, when the prognosis is often very poor.Gallbladder cancer may not be discovered until it's advanced because it often causes no specific signs or symptoms. Also, the relatively hidden nature of the gallbladder makes it easier for gallbladder cancer to grow without being detected.

title: 腱鞘囊肿
desc: 神经节囊肿是最常出现在手腕或手的肌腱或关节上的肿块。它们也可能发生在脚踝和脚部。神经节囊肿通常呈圆形或椭圆形，充满果冻状液体。它们不是癌症。小神经节囊肿可以有豌豆大小。他们可以改变尺寸。如果神经节囊肿压迫附近的神经，可能会感到疼痛。有时它们会影响关节运动。对于引起问题的神经节囊肿，让医疗保健提供者用针引流囊肿可能是一种选择。因此可以通过手术切除囊肿。但如果没有症状，则无需治疗。通常，囊肿会长大和缩小。有些会自行消失。
desc_en: Ganglion cysts are lumps that most often appear along the tendons or joints of wrists or hands. They also can occur in ankles and feet. Ganglion cysts are typically round or oval and are filled with a jellylike fluid. They are not cancer.Small ganglion cysts can be pea-sized. They can change size. Ganglion cysts can be painful if they press on a nearby nerve. Sometimes they affect joint movement.For a ganglion cyst that causes problems, having a health care provider drain the cyst with a needle might be an option. So might removing the cyst surgically. But if there are no symptoms, no treatment is necessary. Often, the cysts grow and shrink. Some go away on their own.

title: 气体和气体疼痛
desc: 坏疽是由于血流不足或严重细菌感染而导致的身体组织死亡。坏疽通常影响手臂和腿部，包括脚趾和手指。它也可能发生在肌肉和体内器官，例如胆囊。可能损害血管并影响血流的疾病，例如糖尿病或动脉硬化（动脉粥样硬化），会增加坏疽的风险。坏疽可能包括抗生素、氧疗以及恢复血流和去除坏死组织的手术。坏疽越早发现和治疗，康复的机会就越大。
desc_en: Gangrene is death of body tissue due to a lack of blood flow or a serious bacterial infection. Gangrene commonly affects the arms and legs, including the toes and fingers. It can also occur in the muscles and in organs inside the body, such as the gallbladder.A condition that can damage the blood vessels and affect blood flow, such as diabetes or hardened arteries (atherosclerosis), increases the risk of gangrene.Treatments for gangrene may include antibiotics, oxygen therapy, and surgery to restore blood flow and remove dead tissue. The earlier gangrene is identified and treated, the better the chances for recovery.

title: 胃炎
desc: 胃炎是一组疾病的总称，它们有一个共同点：胃壁炎症。胃炎炎症通常是由引起大多数胃溃疡的相同细菌感染或定期使用某些止痛药引起的。饮酒过多也会导致胃炎。胃炎可能突然发生（急性胃炎），也可能随着时间的推移缓慢发生（慢性胃炎）。在某些情况下，胃炎会导致溃疡并增加患胃癌的风险。然而，对于大多数人来说，胃炎并不严重，并且通过治疗会迅速改善。
desc_en: Gastritis is a general term for a group of conditions with one thing in common: Inflammation of the lining of the stomach. The inflammation of gastritis is most often the result of infection with the same bacterium that causes most stomach ulcers or the regular use of certain pain relievers. Drinking too much alcohol also can contribute to gastritis.Gastritis may occur suddenly (acute gastritis) or appear slowly over time (chronic gastritis). In some cases, gastritis can lead to ulcers and an increased risk of stomach cancer. For most people, however, gastritis isn't serious and improves quickly with treatment.

title: 胃轻瘫
desc: 胃轻瘫是一种影响胃部肌肉正常自发运动（运动）的疾病。通常，强烈的肌肉收缩会推动食物通过消化道。但如果您患有胃轻瘫，胃的蠕动就会减慢或根本不起作用，从而妨碍胃正常排空。胃轻瘫的原因通常未知。有时这是糖尿病的并发症，有些人在手术后出现胃轻瘫。某些药物，例如阿片类止痛药、某些抗抑郁药以及高血压和过敏药物，可能会导致胃排空缓慢并引起类似症状。对于已经患有胃轻瘫的人来说，这些药物可能会使他们的病情变得更糟。胃轻瘫会干扰正常消化，导致恶心、呕吐和腹痛。它还可能导致血糖水平和营养问题。虽然胃轻瘫无法治愈，但改变饮食和药物治疗可以缓解一些症状。
desc_en: Gastroparesis is a condition that affects the normal spontaneous movement of the muscles (motility) in your stomach. Ordinarily, strong muscular contractions propel food through your digestive tract. But if you have gastroparesis, your stomach's motility is slowed down or doesn't work at all, preventing your stomach from emptying properly.The cause of gastroparesis is usually unknown. Sometimes it's a complication of diabetes, and some people develop gastroparesis after surgery. Certain medications, such as opioid pain relievers, some antidepressants, and high blood pressure and allergy medications, can lead to slow gastric emptying and cause similar symptoms. For people who already have gastroparesis, these medications may make their condition worse.Gastroparesis can interfere with normal digestion, cause nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. It can also cause problems with blood sugar levels and nutrition. Although there's no cure for gastroparesis, changes to your diet, along with medication, can offer some relief.

title: 戈谢病
desc: 戈谢病 (go-SHAY) 是某些器官（特别是脾脏和肝脏）中某些脂肪物质堆积的结果。这会导致这些器官增大并影响其功能。脂肪物质还会在骨组织中积聚，削弱骨骼并增加骨折的风险。如果骨髓受到影响，就会干扰血液的凝固能力。分解这些脂肪物质的酶在戈谢病患者体内无法正常工作。治疗通常包括酶替代疗法。戈谢病是一种遗传性疾病，在东欧和中欧血统的犹太人（德系犹太人）中最常见。症状可以出现在任何年龄。
desc_en: Gaucher (go-SHAY) disease is the result of a buildup of certain fatty substances in certain organs, particularly your spleen and liver. This causes these organs to enlarge and can affect their function.The fatty substances also can build up in bone tissue, weakening the bone and increasing the risk of fractures. If the bone marrow is affected, it can interfere with your blood's ability to clot.An enzyme that breaks down these fatty substances doesn't work properly in people with Gaucher disease. Treatment often includes enzyme replacement therapy.An inherited disorder, Gaucher disease is most common in Jewish people of Eastern and Central European descent (Ashkenazi). Symptoms can appear at any age.

title: 尖锐湿疣
desc: 尖锐湿疣是最常见的性传播感染类型之一。引起疣的病毒称为人乳头瘤病毒 (HPV)。 HPV 有多种类型。几乎所有性活跃的人都会在某个时候感染至少一种类型。尖锐湿疣会影响生殖器区域的潮湿组织。它们看起来像肤色的小肿块。这些肿块可能类似于花椰菜。通常，疣太小，肉眼无法看到。某些生殖器 HPV 菌株可引起生殖器疣。其他可能导致癌症。疫苗可以帮助预防某些生殖器 HPV 菌株。
desc_en: Genital warts are one of the most common types of sexually transmitted infections. The virus that causes the warts is called human papillomavirus (HPV). There are various types of HPV. And nearly all sexually active people will become infected with at least one type at some point.Genital warts affect the moist tissues of the genital area. They can look like small, skin-colored bumps. The bumps may resemble cauliflower. Often, the warts are too small to be seen with your eyes.Some strains of genital HPV can cause genital warts. Others can cause cancer. Vaccines can help protect against certain strains of genital HPV.

title: 地理舌
desc: 地图舌是一种影响舌头表面的炎症但无害的病症。舌头上通常覆盖着微小的粉白色肿块，称为乳头。这些乳头实际上是细小的毛发状结构。对于地图舌，舌头表面的斑块缺少乳头。这些斑块光滑、呈红色，通常有轻微凸起的边缘。这种情况称为地图舌，因为这些斑块使您的舌头看起来像地图。这些斑块通常出现在一个区域，然后移动到舌头的不同部位。虽然地图舌可能看起来令人担忧，但它不会引起健康问题。它与感染或癌症无关。地图舌有时会导致舌头疼痛，并使您对某些食物更加敏感，例如香料、盐甚至糖果。
desc_en: Geographic tongue is an inflammatory but harmless condition affecting the surface of the tongue. The tongue usually is covered with tiny, pinkish-white bumps called papillae. These papillae are actually fine, hairlike structures. With geographic tongue, patches on the surface of the tongue are missing papillae. These patches are smooth and red, often with slightly raised borders.This condition is called geographic tongue because the patches make your tongue look like a map. The patches often appear in one area and then move to a different part of the tongue.Although geographic tongue may look alarming, it does not cause health issues. It's not related to infection or cancer. Geographic tongue sometimes can cause tongue pain and make you more sensitive to certain foods, such as spices, salt and even sweets.

title: 生殖细胞肿瘤
desc: 生殖细胞肿瘤是由生殖细胞形成的细胞生长。肿瘤可以是癌性的或非癌性的。大多数生殖细胞肿瘤发生在睾丸或卵巢。一些生殖细胞肿瘤发生在身体的其他部位，例如腹部、大脑和胸部，但原因尚不清楚。发生在睾丸和卵巢以外部位的生殖细胞肿瘤（性腺外生殖细胞肿瘤）非常罕见。生殖细胞肿瘤的治疗方案可能包括手术切除肿瘤、使用杀死癌细胞的药物进行化疗以及使用强大能量的放射治疗梅奥诊所是美国规模最大、经验最丰富的诊所之一，在亚利桑那州、佛罗里达州和明尼苏达州设有校区。数十个专业领域的熟练工作人员共同努力，确保优质护理和成功康复。梅奥诊所的医生和研究人员正在研究治疗生殖细胞肿瘤患者的新方法。癌症研究是与 Major Clinics 综合癌症中心协调进行的。Major Clinics 综合癌症中心符合美国国家癌症研究所综合癌症中心的严格标准，该标准认可科学卓越性和专注于癌症预防、诊断和治疗的多专业方法。参见梅奥诊所医生在国家医学图书馆服务 PubMed 上发表的有关生殖细胞肿瘤的出版物列表。
desc_en:
Germ cell tumors are growths of cells that form from reproductive cells. The tumors may be cancerous or not cancerous. Most germ cell tumors occur in the testicles or the ovaries.Some germ cell tumors occur in other areas of the body, such as the abdomen, brain and chest, though it's not clear why. Germ cell tumors that occur in places other than the testicles and ovaries (extragonadal germ cell tumors) are very rare.Treatment options for germ cell tumors may include surgery to remove the tumor, chemotherapy with drugs that kill cancer cells and radiation therapy with powerful energy beams.Major Clinics has one of the largest and most experienced practices in the United States,
with campuses in Arizona, Florida and Minnesota. Staff skilled in dozens of specialties work
together to ensure quality care and successful recovery.Major Clinics doctors and researchers are studying new ways to care for people with germ cell tumors. Cancer research is conducted in coordination with the Major Clinics Comprehensive Cancer Center.Major Clinics Comprehensive Cancer Center meets the strict standards for a National Cancer Institute comprehensive cancer center, which recognize scientific excellence and a multispecialty approach focused on cancer prevention, diagnosis and treatment.See a list of publications about germ cell tumors by Major Clinics doctors on PubMed, a service of the National Library of Medicine.

title: 巨细胞动脉炎
desc: 巨细胞动脉炎是动脉内壁的炎症。最常见的是，它会影响您头部的动脉，尤其是太阳穴的动脉。因此，巨细胞动脉炎有时被称为颞动脉炎。巨细胞动脉炎经常引起头痛、头皮压痛、下巴疼痛和视力问题。如果不及时治疗，可能会导致失明。及时使用皮质类固醇药物治疗通常可以缓解巨细胞动脉炎的症状，并可能防止视力丧失。开始治疗后几天内，您可能会开始感觉好一些。但即使经过治疗，复发也很常见。您需要定期去看医生，进行检查并治疗服用皮质类固醇引起的任何副作用。
desc_en: Giant cell arteritis is an inflammation of the lining of your arteries. Most often, it affects the arteries in your head, especially those in your temples. For this reason, giant cell arteritis is sometimes called temporal arteritis.Giant cell arteritis frequently causes headaches, scalp tenderness, jaw pain and vision problems. Untreated, it can lead to blindness.Prompt treatment with corticosteroid medications usually relieves symptoms of giant cell arteritis and might prevent loss of vision. You'll likely begin to feel better within days of starting treatment. But even with treatment, relapses are common.You'll need to visit your doctor regularly for checkups and treatment of any side effects from taking corticosteroids.

title: 贾第鞭毛虫感染（贾第鞭毛虫病）
牙龈炎
desc: 牙龈炎是一种常见且轻微的牙龈疾病，也称为牙周病。它会导致牙龈（牙根周围的牙龈部分）发炎、发红、肿胀和出血。认真对待牙龈炎并及时治疗很重要。牙龈炎不会导致骨质流失。但如果不及时治疗，可能会导致更严重的牙龈疾病，称为牙周炎和牙齿脱落。牙龈炎最常见的原因是没有保持牙齿和牙龈清洁和健康。良好的口腔健康习惯，例如每天至少刷牙两次、每天使用牙线和定期进行牙科检查，有助于预防和逆转牙龈炎。
desc_en: Gingivitis is a common and mild form of gum disease, also called periodontal disease. It causes irritation, redness, swelling and bleeding of your gingiva, which is the part of your gum around the base of your teeth. It's important to take gingivitis seriously and treat it promptly. Gingivitis does not cause bone loss. But left untreated, it can lead to a much more serious gum disease, called periodontitis, and tooth loss.The most common cause of gingivitis is not keeping your teeth and gums clean and healthy. Good oral health habits, such as brushing at least twice a day, flossing daily and getting regular dental checkups, can help prevent and reverse gingivitis.

title: 青光眼
desc: 青光眼是一组损害视神经的眼部疾病。视神经将视觉信息从眼睛发送到大脑，对于良好的视力至关重要。视神经损伤通常与眼压有关。但即使眼压正常，青光眼也可能发生。青光眼可以发生在任何年龄，但在老年人中更为常见。它是 60 岁以上人群失明的主要原因之一。许多形式的青光眼没有任何警告信号。这种影响是渐进的，您可能直到病情后期才注意到视力的变化。定期进行眼科检查（包括测量眼压）非常重要。如果及早发现青光眼，就可以减缓或预防视力丧失。如果您患有青光眼，您将需要终生接受治疗或监测。
desc_en: Glaucoma is a group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve. The optic nerve sends visual information from your eye to your brain and is vital for good vision. Damage to the optic nerve is often related to high pressure in your eye. But glaucoma can happen even with normal eye pressure.Glaucoma can occur at any age but is more common in older adults. It is one of the leading causes of blindness for people over the age of 60.Many forms of glaucoma have no warning signs. The effect is so gradual that you may not notice a change in vision until the condition is in its later stages.It's important to have regular eye exams that include measurements of your eye pressure. If glaucoma is recognized early, vision loss can be slowed or prevented. If you have glaucoma, you'll need treatment or monitoring for the rest of your life.

title: 神经胶质瘤
desc: 神经胶质瘤是一种始于大脑或脊髓的细胞生长。神经胶质瘤中的细胞看起来与健康的脑细胞（称为神经胶质细胞）相似。神经胶质细胞包围神经细胞并帮助它们发挥功能。随着神经胶质瘤的生长，它会形成称为肿瘤的细胞团。肿瘤可能会生长并压迫大脑或脊髓组织并引起症状。症状取决于大脑或脊髓的哪个部分受到影响。神经胶质瘤有多种类型。有些生长缓慢，不被认为是癌症。其他则被认为是癌性的。癌症的另一个词是恶性的。恶性神经胶质瘤生长迅速，可以侵入健康的脑组织。某些类型的神经胶质瘤主要发生在成人中。其他大多发生在儿童中。您所患的神经胶质瘤类型可以帮助您的医疗保健团队了解您的病情有多严重以及哪种治疗方法可能最有效。一般来说，神经胶质瘤的治疗选择包括手术、放射治疗、化疗等。
desc_en: Glioma is a growth of cells that starts in the brain or spinal cord. The cells in a glioma look similar to healthy brain cells called glial cells. Glial cells surround nerve cells and help them function.As a glioma grows it forms a mass of cells called a tumor. The tumor can grow to press on brain or spinal cord tissue and cause symptoms. Symptoms depend on which part of the brain or spinal cord is affected.There are many types of glioma. Some grow slowly and aren't considered to be cancers. Others are considered cancerous. Another word for cancerous is malignant. Malignant gliomas grow quickly and can invade healthy brain tissue. Some types of glioma happen mostly in adults. Others happen mostly in kids.The type of glioma you have helps your health care team understand how serious your condition is and what treatments might work best. In general, glioma treatment options include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy and others.

title: 淋病
desc: 淋病是一种性传播感染，也称为性传播疾病，由细菌引起。性传播疾病是主要通过接触生殖器或体液传播的感染。性传播感染也称为 STD、STI 或性病，是由细菌、病毒或寄生虫引起的。淋病细菌可以感染尿道、直肠、女性生殖道、口腔、喉咙或眼睛。淋病最常在阴道、口交或肛交过程中传播。但婴儿可能会在分娩过程中受到感染。在婴儿中，淋病最常影响眼睛。避免性活动和不发生性行为可以防止淋病传播。在性活动中使用安全套有助于防止淋病传播。在相互一夫一妻制的关系中，双方只发生性行为，双方都没有被感染，这也限制了感染的风险。
desc_en: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted infection, also called a sexually transmitted disease, caused by bacteria. Sexually transmitted diseases are infections spread mainly by contact with genitals or bodily fluids. Also called STDs, STIs or venereal disease, sexually transmitted infections are caused by bacteria, viruses or parasites.Gonorrhea bacteria can infect the urethra, rectum, female reproductive tract, mouth, throat or eyes. Gonorrhea is most commonly spread during vaginal, oral or anal sexual activity. But babies can get the infection during childbirth. In babies, gonorrhea most commonly affects the eyes.Avoiding sexual activity and not having sex prevents the spread of gonorrhea. Using a condom during sexual activity can help prevent the spread of gonorrhea. Being in a mutually monogamous relationship, in which both partners have sex only with each other and neither partner is infected, also limits the risk of an infection.

title: 痛风
desc: 痛风是一种常见且复杂的关节炎，可以影响任何人。它的特点是一个或多个关节（最常见的是大脚趾）突然出现严重的疼痛、肿胀、发红和压痛。痛风发作可能会突然发生，通常会在半夜将您惊醒，并伴有以下感觉：你的大脚趾着火了。受影响的关节又热又肿，而且很痛，甚至连床单的重量都让人难以忍受。痛风症状可能会反复发作，但有一些方法可以控制症状并预防发作。
desc_en: Gout is a common and complex form of arthritis that can affect anyone. It's characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, swelling, redness and tenderness in one or more joints, most often in the big toe.An attack of gout can occur suddenly, often waking you up in the middle of the night with the sensation that your big toe is on fire. The affected joint is hot, swollen and so tender that even the weight of the bedsheet on it may seem intolerable.Gout symptoms may come and go, but there are ways to manage symptoms and prevent flares.

title: 环状肉芽肿
desc: 环状肉芽肿 (gran-u-LOW-muh an-u-LAR-e) 是一种皮肤病，会导致出现环状皮疹或肿块。最常见的类型影响年轻人，通常发生在手和脚上。轻微的皮肤损伤和某些药物可能会引发这种情况。它不具有传染性，通常不会造成疼痛，但会让您感到难为情。如果它成为长期病症，可能会导致情绪困扰。治疗可能会逐渐清除皮肤，但肿块往往会复发。如果不治疗，这种情况可能会持续几周到几十年。
desc_en: Granuloma annulare (gran-u-LOW-muh an-u-LAR-e) is a skin condition that causes a raised rash or bumps in a ring pattern. The most common type affects young adults, usually on the hands and feet.Minor skin injuries and some medicines might trigger the condition. It's not contagious and usually not painful, but it can make you feel self-conscious. And if it becomes a long-term condition, it can cause emotional distress.Treatment might clear the skin gradually, but the bumps tend to come back. Untreated, the condition might last from a few weeks to decades.

title: 韦格纳肉芽肿
desc: 肉芽肿性多血管炎是一种罕见的疾病，会导致鼻子、鼻窦、喉咙、肺和肾脏的血管发炎。这种疾病以前称为韦格纳肉芽肿病，是称为血管炎的一组血管疾病之一。它会减慢流向某些器官的血液速度。受影响的组织可能会出现称为肉芽肿的炎症区域，这会影响这些器官的工作方式。肉芽肿性多血管炎的早期诊断和治疗可能会导致完全康复。如果不治疗，这种情况可能是致命的。
desc_en: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis is an uncommon disorder that causes inflammation of the blood vessels in your nose, sinuses, throat, lungs and kidneys.Formerly called Wegener's granulomatosis, this condition is one of a group of blood vessel disorders called vasculitis. It slows blood flow to some of your organs. The affected tissues can develop areas of inflammation called granulomas, which can affect how these organs work.Early diagnosis and treatment of granulomatosis with polyangiitis might lead to a full recovery. Without treatment, the condition can be fatal.

title: 生长板骨折
desc: 生长板骨折会影响儿童骨骼末端附近的生长组织层。生长板是骨骼中最柔软、最薄弱的部分——有时甚至比周围的韧带和肌腱还要弱。可能导致成人关节扭伤的损伤可能会导致儿童生长板骨折。生长板骨折通常需要立即治疗，因为它们会影响骨骼的生长方式。生长板骨折治疗不当可能会导致骨折的骨头比对侧肢体更弯曲或更短。通过适当的治疗，大多数生长板骨折都会愈合而不会出现并发症。
type: Limb Lengthening and Regeneration Clinic in Minnesota
Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: A growth plate fracture affects the layer of growing tissue near the ends of a child's bones. Growth plates are the softest and weakest sections of the skeleton — sometimes even weaker than surrounding ligaments and tendons. An injury that might cause a joint sprain for an adult can cause a growth plate fracture in a child.Growth plate fractures often need immediate treatment because they can affect how the bone will grow. An improperly treated growth plate fracture could result in a fractured bone ending up more crooked or shorter than its opposite limb. With proper treatment, most growth plate fractures heal without complications.

title: 脱发
desc: 脱发（脱发）可能只影响您的头皮或整个身体，而且可能是暂时的或永久性的。它可能是遗传、荷尔蒙变化、医疗状况或正常衰老的结果。任何人都可能脱发，但男性更常见。秃顶通常是指头皮过度脱发。随着年龄的增长遗传性脱发是秃头的最常见原因。有些人宁愿让自己的脱发不经治疗、不隐藏地自然发展。其他人可能会用发型、化妆品、帽子或围巾来掩盖它。还有一些人选择一种可用的治疗方法来防止进一步脱发或恢复生长。在进行脱发治疗之前，请与您的医生讨论脱发的原因和治疗方案。
desc_en: Hair loss (alopecia) can affect just your scalp or your entire body, and it can be temporary or permanent. It can be the result of heredity, hormonal changes, medical conditions or a normal part of aging. Anyone can lose hair on their head, but it's more common in men.Baldness typically refers to excessive hair loss from your scalp. Hereditary hair loss with age is the most common cause of baldness. Some people prefer to let their hair loss run its course untreated and unhidden. Others may cover it up with hairstyles, makeup, hats or scarves. And still others choose one of the treatments available to prevent further hair loss or restore growth.Before pursuing hair loss treatment, talk with your doctor about the cause of your hair loss and treatment options.

title: 毛细胞白血病
desc: 毛细胞白血病是白细胞的癌症。白细胞有助于抵抗细菌。白细胞有几种不同类型。与毛细胞白血病有关的白细胞称为 B 细胞。 B 细胞也称为 B 淋巴细胞。在毛细胞白血病中，身体会产生过多的 B 细胞。这些细胞看起来不像健康的 B 细胞。相反，它们发生了变化，变成了白血病细胞。白血病细胞在显微镜下看起来“毛茸茸的”。作为自然细胞生命周期的一部分，当健康细胞死亡时，毛细胞白血病细胞仍然存活。白血病细胞在体内积聚并引起症状。毛细胞白血病通常会缓慢恶化。治疗可能不需要立即开始。当需要时，通常采用化疗进行治疗。科学家发现了一种看起来像毛细胞白血病的癌症，但它恶化得更快。这种另一种类型的癌症称为毛细胞白血病变异型。尽管名称相似，但它被认为是与毛细胞白血病不同的一种癌症。
desc_en: Hairy cell leukemia is a cancer of the white blood cells. The white blood cells help fight off germs. There are a few different types of white blood cells. The white blood cells involved in hairy cell leukemia are called B cells. B cells are also called B lymphocytes.In hairy cell leukemia, the body makes too many B cells. The cells don't look like healthy B cells. Instead, they've undergone changes to become leukemia cells. The leukemia cells look "hairy" under a microscope.Hairy cell leukemia cells keep living when healthy cells would die as part of the natural cell life cycle. The leukemia cells build up in the body and cause symptoms.Hairy cell leukemia often gets worse slowly. Treatment might not need to start right away. When it's needed, treatment is usually with chemotherapy.Scientists found a type of cancer that looks like hairy cell leukemia, but it gets worse much faster. This other type of cancer is called hairy cell leukemia variant. It's considered a separate type of cancer from hairy cell leukemia, even though it has a similar name.

title: 宿醉
desc: 腿筋损伤涉及拉伤或拉伤其中一根腿筋肌肉（沿着大腿后部延伸的三块肌肉）。腿筋损伤通常发生在进行突然停止和开始的冲刺运动的人身上。例子包括足球、篮球、橄榄球和网球。跑步者和舞者也可能发生腿筋损伤。休息、冰敷和止痛药等自我护理措施通常就可以缓解腿筋损伤的疼痛和肿胀。很少进行手术来修复腿筋肌肉或肌腱。
desc_en: A hamstring injury involves straining or pulling one of the hamstring muscles — the group of three muscles that run along the back of the thigh.Hamstring injuries often occur in people who play sports that involves sprinting with sudden stops and starts. Examples include soccer, basketball, football and tennis. Hamstring injuries can occur in runners and in dancers as well.Self-care measures such as rest, ice and pain medicine are often all that's needed to relieve the pain and swelling of a hamstring injury. Rarely, surgery is done to repair a hamstring muscle or tendon.

title: 汉坦病毒肺综合征
desc: 宿醉是饮酒过量后可能出现的一组令人不快的症状。感觉糟糕还不够糟糕，频繁宿醉还与表现不佳以及家庭、学校和工作中的冲突有关。一般来说，喝的酒越多，第二天宿醉的可能性就越大。但没有简单的方法可以知道您可以安全喝多少酒并仍然避免宿醉。无论多么令人不快，大多数宿醉都会自行消失，尽管它们可持续长达 24 小时。如果您选择饮酒，负责任地饮酒可以帮助您远离宿醉。
desc_en: A hangover is a group of unpleasant symptoms that can happen after drinking too much alcohol. As if feeling awful weren't bad enough, frequent hangovers also are linked with poor performance and conflict at home, school and work.Generally, the more alcohol you drink, the more likely you are to have a hangover the next day. But there's no easy way to know how much you can safely drink and still avoid a hangover.However unpleasant, most hangovers go away on their own, though they can last up to 24 hours. If you choose to drink alcohol, doing so responsibly can help you stay away from hangovers.

title: 头颈癌
type: Trauma, Critical Care and General Surgery in Rochester

title: 儿童头痛
desc: 头颈癌是始于头颈部的癌症。头颈部可能发生多种癌症。每种癌症都以细胞生长开始，可以侵入并破坏健康的身体组织。头颈癌通常指始于口腔、喉咙、鼻窦和唾液腺的癌症。但其他癌症也可能发生在头颈部，有时也被视为此类癌症。头颈癌不是一种诊断。相反，它是一类具有一些共同点的癌症。例如，许多头颈癌都有一些共同的危险因素和治疗方法。大多数头颈癌始于鳞状细胞。这些薄而扁平的细胞构成了皮肤的外层。它们还排列在鼻子、嘴巴和喉咙的内部。始于鳞状细胞的癌症称为鳞状细胞癌。癌症可能始于头颈区域的其他类型的细胞，尽管这些细胞不太常见。头颈癌的治疗方法取决于许多因素。这些可能包括癌症的位置、大小和所涉及的细胞类型。您的医疗团队也会考虑您的整体健康状况。治疗选择可能包括手术、放射治疗、化疗等。
desc_en: Head and neck cancers are cancers that start in the head and neck area. There are many kinds of cancer that can happen in the head and neck. Each kind begins as a growth of cells that can invade and destroy healthy body tissue.Head and neck cancer often refers to cancers that start in the mouth, throat, sinuses and salivary glands. But other cancers can happen in the head and neck and are sometimes considered part of this category too.Head and neck cancer isn't a diagnosis. Instead, it's a category of cancers that have some things in common. For example, many head and neck cancers share some risk factors and treatments. Most head and neck cancers begin in squamous cells. These thin, flat cells make up the outer layer of the skin. They also line the inside of the nose, mouth and throat. Cancers that begin in the squamous cells are called squamous cell carcinomas. Cancers can begin in other kinds of cells in the head and neck area, though these are less common.Which treatment you'll have for your head and neck cancer depends on many factors. These might include the location of the cancer, its size and the type of cells involved. Your healthcare team also considers your overall health. Treatment options might include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy and others.

title: 听力损失
desc: 随着年龄的增长，听力逐渐丧失（也称为老年性耳聋）是很常见的。在美国，75 岁以上的人中有一半以上患有与年龄相关的听力损失。听力损失分为三种类型： 衰老和周围的噪音都会导致听力损失。其他因素（例如过多的耳垢）可能会在一段时间内降低耳朵的工作能力。您通常无法恢复听力。但有一些方法可以改善您听到的内容。
desc_en: Hearing loss that comes on little by little as you age, also known as presbycusis, is common. More than half the people in the United States older than age 75 have some age-related hearing loss.There are three types of hearing loss:Aging and being around loud noises both can cause hearing loss. Other factors, such as too much earwax, can lower how well ears work for a time.You usually can't get hearing back. But there are ways to improve what you hear.

title: 心律失常
desc: 心律失常 (uh-RITH-me-uh) 是一种不规则的心跳。当告诉心脏跳动的电信号无法正常工作时，就会发生心律失常。心脏可能跳得太快或太慢。或者心跳的模式可能不一致。心律失常可能感觉像是心扑动、重击或加速。有些心律失常是无害的。其他可能会导致危及生命的症状。有时心跳快或慢都是正常的。例如，心脏可能会在运动时跳动加快或在睡眠时跳动减慢。心律失常的治疗可能包括药物、起搏器等设备或手术或手术。治疗的目标是控制或消除快、慢或其他不规则的心跳。有利于心脏健康的生活方式有助于预防可能引发某些心律失常的心脏损伤。一般来说，心律失常按心率的速度进行分组。例如： 心动过速的类型包括： 心率低于每分钟 60 次被视为心动过缓。但静息心率低并不总是意味着存在问题。如果您身体健康，您的心脏可能能够以每分钟少于 60 次的心跳向身体泵送足够的血液。如果您的心率缓慢且心脏泵送的血液不足，您可能患有某种类型的心脏衰竭。心动过缓。心动过缓的类型包括： 过早心跳是一次出现一次的额外心跳，有时与正常心跳交替出现。如果额外的搏动来自心脏的顶腔，则称为心房性早搏（PAC）。如果它们来自底部心室，则称为室性早搏 (PVC)。心跳过早可能会感觉您的心脏停跳了一拍。这些额外的节拍通常不需要担心。它们很少意味着您的病情更严重。尽管如此，过早心跳仍会引发更持久的心律失常，尤其是患有心脏病的人。偶尔，非常频繁的室性早搏可能会导致心脏衰弱。休息时可能会出现心跳过早。压力、剧烈运动和使用咖啡因或尼古丁等兴奋剂也可能导致心跳过早。
desc_en: A heart arrhythmia (uh-RITH-me-uh) is an irregular heartbeat. A heart arrhythmia occurs when the electrical signals that tell the heart to beat don't work properly. The heart may beat too fast or too slow. Or the pattern of the heartbeat may be inconsistent.A heart arrhythmia may feel like a fluttering, pounding or racing heartbeat. Some heart arrhythmias are harmless. Others may cause life-threatening symptoms.There are times when it is OK to have a fast or slow heartbeat. For example, the heart may beat faster with exercise or slow down during sleep.Heart arrhythmia treatment may include medicines, devices such as pacemakers, or a procedure or surgery. The goals of treatment are to control or get rid of fast, slow or otherwise irregular heartbeats. A heart-healthy lifestyle can help prevent heart damage that can trigger some heart arrhythmias.In general, heart arrhythmias are grouped by the speed of the heart rate. For example:Types of tachycardias include:A heart rate below 60 beats a minute is considered bradycardia. But a low resting heart rate doesn't always mean there's a problem. If you're physically fit, your heart may be able to pump enough blood to the body with less than 60 beats a minute.If you have a slow heart rate and your heart isn't pumping enough blood, you may have a type of bradycardia. Types of bradycardias include:Premature heartbeats are extra beats that occur one at a time, sometimes in patterns that alternate with a regular heartbeat. If the extra beats come from the top chamber of the heart, they are called premature atrial contractions (PACs). If they come from the bottom chamber, they are called premature ventricular contractions (PVCs).A premature heartbeat may feel like your heart skipped a beat. These extra beats are generally not a concern. They rarely mean you have a more serious condition. Still, a premature beat can trigger a longer lasting arrhythmia, especially in people with heart disease. Occasionally, having very frequent premature ventricular beats may lead to a weak heart.Premature heartbeats may occur when resting. Stress, heavy exercise and the use of stimulants, such as caffeine or nicotine, also may cause premature heartbeats.

title: 心脏杂音
desc: 心脏病描述了一系列影响心脏的疾病。心脏病包括：许多形式的心脏病可以通过选择健康的生活方式来预防或治疗。
desc_en: Heart disease describes a range of conditions that affect the heart. Heart diseases include:Many forms of heart disease can be prevented or treated with healthy lifestyle choices.

title: 心脏瓣膜疾病
desc: 在心脏瓣膜疾病中，心脏中的一个或多个瓣膜无法正常工作。心脏有四个瓣膜。它们使血液以正确的方向流经心脏。有时阀门不会完全打开或关闭。这可以改变血液通过心脏流向身体其他部位的方式。心脏瓣膜疾病的治疗取决于受影响的心脏瓣膜以及疾病的类型和严重程度。有时需要手术来修复或更换心脏瓣膜。
desc_en: In heart valve disease, one or more of the valves in the heart doesn't work properly. There are four heart valves. They keep blood flowing through the heart in the correct direction. Sometimes a valve doesn't open or close all the way. This can change how blood flows through the heart to the rest of the body.Heart valve disease treatment depends on the heart valve affected and the type and severity of the disease. Sometimes surgery is needed to repair or replace the heart valve.

title: 中暑
desc: 热衰竭是身体过热时发生的一种情况。症状可能包括大量出汗和脉搏加快。热衰竭是三种与热有关的疾病之一，热痉挛是最轻微的，中暑是最严重的。热病的原因包括暴露在高温下，特别是在高湿度的情况下，以及剧烈的体力活动。如果不及时治疗，热衰竭会导致中暑，这是一种危及生命的疾病。幸运的是，热衰竭是可以预防的。
desc_en: Heat exhaustion is a condition that happens when your body overheats. Symptoms may include heavy sweating and a rapid pulse. Heat exhaustion is one of three heat-related illnesses, with heat cramps being the mildest and heatstroke being the most serious.Causes of heat illness include exposure to high temperatures, particularly when there is also high humidity, and strenuous physical activity. Without prompt treatment, heat exhaustion can lead to heatstroke, a life-threatening condition. Fortunately, heat exhaustion is preventable.

title: 中暑
desc: 中暑是由于身体过热而引起的疾病，通常是由于长时间暴露在高温下或在高温下进行体力消耗造成的。如果您的体温升至 104 华氏度（40 摄氏度）或更高，则可能会发生这种最严重的热损伤，即中暑。这种情况在夏季最为常见。中暑需要紧急治疗。未经治疗的中暑会迅速损害您的大脑、心脏、肾脏和肌肉。治疗延迟的时间越长，损害就会越严重，从而增加发生严重并发症或死亡的风险。
desc_en: Heatstroke is a condition caused by your body overheating, usually as a result of prolonged exposure to or physical exertion in high temperatures. This most serious form of heat injury, heatstroke, can occur if your body temperature rises to 104 F (40 C) or higher. The condition is most common in the summer months.Heatstroke requires emergency treatment. Untreated heatstroke can quickly damage your brain, heart, kidneys and muscles. The damage worsens the longer treatment is delayed, increasing your risk of serious complications or death.

title: 血管瘤
desc: 血管瘤（he-man-jee-O-muh），也称为婴儿血管瘤或婴儿血管瘤，是一种鲜红色的胎记。它看起来像橡胶状肿块或扁平红色斑块，由皮肤中的额外血管组成。该痕迹在出生时或出生后第一个月就会出现。血管瘤通常出现在面部、头皮、胸部或背部，但也可能出现在皮肤的任何地方。婴儿的血管瘤通常不需要治疗，因为痕迹会随着时间的推移而消失。通常情况下，到 10 岁时，血管瘤就几乎消失了。如果血管瘤导致视力、呼吸或其他身体功能出现问题，您可能需要考虑对孩子进行治疗。如果血管瘤位于美容敏感区域，您也可以考虑治疗。
type: Trauma, Critical Care and General Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: A hemangioma (he-man-jee-O-muh), also known as an infantile hemangioma or hemangioma of infancy, is a bright red birthmark. It looks like a rubbery bump or flat red patch and is made up of extra blood vessels in the skin. The mark shows up at birth or in the first month of life.A hemangioma typically appears on the face, scalp, chest or back, though it can be anywhere on the skin. Treatment generally isn't needed for a baby's hemangioma, as the mark fades over time. Typically, there is little trace of it by age 10. You may want to think about treatment for the child if a hemangioma leads to problems with vision, breathing or other bodily functions. You also may think about treatment if the hemangioma is in a cosmetically sensitive area.

title: 溶血性尿毒症综合征（HUS）
desc: 溶血性尿毒症综合征 (HUS) 是一种当小血管受损和发炎时可能发生的疾病。这种损害会导致全身血管中形成血栓。血栓会损害肾脏和其他器官。溶血性尿毒症综合征可导致肾衰竭，从而危及生命。任何人都可能患有溶血性尿毒症综合征。但它在幼儿中最常见。最常见的原因是某些大肠杆菌菌株的感染。其他感染、某些药物或妊娠、癌症或自身免疫性疾病等疾病也可能导致溶血性尿毒症综合征。它也可能是某些基因改变的结果。溶血性尿毒症综合征很严重。但及时治疗可以使大多数人，尤其是幼儿完全康复。
desc_en: Hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS) is a condition that can occur when small blood vessels become damaged and inflamed. This damage can cause clots to form in the vessels all through the body. The clots can damage the kidneys and other organs. Hemolytic uremic syndrome can lead to kidney failure, which can be life-threatening.Anyone can get hemolytic uremic syndrome. But it's most common in young children. Most often, infection with certain strains of Escherichia coli (E. coli) bacteria is the cause.Other infections, certain medicines or conditions such as pregnancy, cancer or autoimmune diseases can cause hemolytic uremic syndrome. It also can be the result of certain gene changes.Hemolytic uremic syndrome is serious. But treating it in time leads to a full recovery for most people, especially young children.

title: 血友病
desc: 血友病是一种罕见的疾病，血液不会以典型的方式凝固，因为它没有足够的凝血蛋白（凝血因子）。如果您患有血友病，受伤后流血的时间可能会比血液正常凝固时流血的时间更长。小伤口通常不是什么大问题。如果您病情严重，主要担心的是体内出血，尤其是膝盖、脚踝和肘部。内出血会损害您的器官和组织并危及生命。血友病几乎总是一种遗传性疾病。治疗包括定期更换减少的特定凝血因子。不含凝血因子的新疗法也正在使用。
desc_en: Hemophilia is a rare disorder in which the blood doesn't clot in the typical way because it doesn't have enough blood-clotting proteins (clotting factors). If you have hemophilia, you might bleed for a longer time after an injury than you would if your blood clotted properly.Small cuts usually aren't much of a problem. If you have a severe form of the condition, the main concern is bleeding inside your body, especially in your knees, ankles and elbows. Internal bleeding can damage your organs and tissues and be life-threatening.Hemophilia is almost always a genetic disorder. Treatment includes regular replacement of the specific clotting factor that is reduced. Newer therapies that don't contain clotting factors also are being used.

title: 痔疮
desc: 痔疮 (HEM-uh-roids)，也称为痔疮，是肛门和直肠下部的静脉肿胀。痔疮与静脉曲张相似。痔疮可以在直肠内形成，称为内痔。它们也可以在肛门周围的皮肤下生长，称为外痔。治疗痔疮的方法有多种。许多人通过家庭治疗和生活方式的改变而得到缓解。
desc_en: Hemorrhoids (HEM-uh-roids), also called piles, are swollen veins in the anus and lower rectum. Hemorrhoids are similar to varicose veins. Hemorrhoids can develop inside the rectum, called internal hemorrhoids. They also can develop under the skin around the anus, called external hemorrhoids.There are several options available to treat hemorrhoids. Many people get relief with home treatments and lifestyle changes.

title: 甲型肝炎
desc: 甲型肝炎是由甲型肝炎病毒引起的高度传染性肝脏感染。该病毒是引起肝脏炎症并影响肝脏功能的多种肝炎病毒之一。您最有可能通过受污染的食物或水或与受感染的人或物体密切接触而感染甲型肝炎。轻度甲型肝炎不需要治疗。大多数感染者可以完全康复，不会造成永久性肝损伤。保持良好的卫生习惯，包括经常洗手，可以防止病毒传播。甲型肝炎疫苗可以预防甲型肝炎。
desc_en: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus. The virus is one of several types of hepatitis viruses that cause liver inflammation and affect your liver's ability to function.You're most likely to get hepatitis A from contaminated food or water or from close contact with a person or object that's infected. Mild cases of hepatitis A don't require treatment. Most people who are infected recover completely with no permanent liver damage.Practicing good hygiene, including washing hands frequently, can prevent the spread of the virus. The hepatitis A vaccine can protect against hepatitis A.

title: 乙型肝炎
desc: 乙型肝炎是由乙型肝炎病毒（HBV）引起的严重肝脏感染。对于大多数人来说，乙型肝炎是短期的，也称为急性，持续时间不超过六个月。但对于其他人来说，感染会变成慢性，这意味着它会持续六个月以上。患有慢性乙型肝炎会增加患肝衰竭、肝癌或肝硬化的风险，这种情况会导致肝脏永久性留下疤痕。大多数患有乙型肝炎的成年人即使症状很严重，也会完全康复。婴儿和儿童更有可能出现长期乙型肝炎感染。这被称为慢性感染。疫苗可以预防乙型肝炎，但如果您患有这种疾病，则无法治愈。如果您被感染，采取某些预防措施可以帮助防止将病毒传播给其他人。
desc_en: Hepatitis B is a serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV). For most people, hepatitis B is short term, also called acute, and lasts less than six months. But for others, the infection becomes chronic, meaning it lasts more than six months. Having chronic hepatitis B increases your risk of developing liver failure, liver cancer or cirrhosis — a condition that permanently scars the liver.Most adults with hepatitis B recover fully, even if their symptoms are severe. Infants and children are more likely to develop a long-lasting hepatitis B infection. This is known as a chronic infection.A vaccine can prevent hepatitis B, but there's no cure if you have the condition. If you're infected, taking certain precautions can help prevent spreading the virus to others.

title: 丙型肝炎
desc: 丙型肝炎是一种导致肝脏肿胀（称为炎症）的病毒感染。丙型肝炎可导致严重的肝脏损害。丙型肝炎病毒 (HCV) 通过接触含有病毒的血液进行传播。对于大多数患有慢性丙型肝炎感染的人来说，新型抗病毒药物是首选治疗方法。这些药物通常可以治愈慢性丙型肝炎。但许多丙型肝炎患者并不知道自己患有这种疾病。这主要是因为症状可能需要数十年才会出现。因此，美国预防服务工作组建议对所有 18 至 79 岁的成年人进行丙型肝炎筛查。筛查适合所有人，甚至是那些没有症状或已知肝病的人。
desc_en: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver swelling, called inflammation. Hepatitis C can lead to serious liver damage. The hepatitis C virus (HCV) spreads through contact with blood that has the virus in it.Newer antiviral medicines are the treatment of choice for most people with the ongoing, called chronic, hepatitis C infection. These medicines often can cure chronic hepatitis C.But many people with hepatitis C don't know they have it. That's mainly because symptoms can take decades to appear. So, the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force recommends that all adults ages 18 to 79 years be screened for hepatitis C.Screening is for everyone, even those who don't have symptoms or known liver disease.

title: 肝肺综合征
desc: 肝肺 (hep-uh-toe-POOL-moe-nar-e) 综合征是由肺部血管扩张（也称为扩张）和数量增加引起的。这种情况会影响患有晚期肝病的人的肺部。肺部的这些变化使红细胞难以吸收氧气。那么肺部就无法向身体输送足够的氧气。这会导致血液中的氧气含量较低，也称为低氧血症。肝脏疾病与肺部疾病之间的关系目前尚不清楚。肝移植是治疗肝肺综合征的唯一方法。
desc_en: Hepatopulmonary (hep-uh-toe-POOL-moe-nar-e) syndrome is caused by blood vessels in the lungs expanding, also called dilating, and increasing in number. This condition affects the lungs of people who have advanced liver disease.These changes in the lungs make it hard for red blood cells to take in oxygen. Then the lungs can't send enough oxygen to the body. This leads to low oxygen levels in the blood, also called hypoxemia. How liver disease is linked to the lung condition isn't yet known. A liver transplant is the only cure for hepatopulmonary syndrome.

title: 椎间盘突出
desc: 椎间盘突出是指一种称为椎间盘的橡胶垫的问题，该垫位于堆叠形成脊柱的骨头之间。这些骨头称为椎骨。椎间盘有一个柔软的果冻状中心，称为核。细胞核被包裹在一个更坚韧、有弹性的外部，称为环面。当一些髓核通过纤维环的撕裂处推出时，就会发生椎间盘突出。椎间盘突出有时被称为椎间盘突出或椎间盘破裂。椎间盘突出可以发生在脊柱的任何部位，最常见的是发生在下背部。根据椎间盘突出的位置，它可能会导致手臂或腿部疼痛、麻木或无力。许多人没有椎间盘突出的症状。对于确实有症状的人来说，症状往往会随着时间的推移而改善。通常不需要手术来缓解问题。
desc_en: A herniated disk refers to a problem with one of the rubbery cushions, called disks, that sit between the bones that stack to make the spine. These bones are called vertebrae.A spinal disk has a soft, jellylike center called a nucleus. The nucleus is encased in a tougher, rubbery exterior, known as the annulus. A herniated disk occurs when some of the nucleus pushes out through a tear in the annulus. A herniated disk is sometimes called a slipped disk or a ruptured disk.A herniated disk, which can occur in any part of the spine, most often occurs in the lower back. Depending on where the herniated disk is, it can result in pain, numbness or weakness in an arm or a leg.Many people have no symptoms from a herniated disk. For people who do have symptoms, the symptoms tend to improve over time. Surgery is usually not needed to relieve the problem.

title: 食管裂孔疝
desc: 当胃的上部通过分隔腹部和胸部的大肌肉凸出时，就会发生食管裂孔疝。肌肉称为横膈膜。横膈膜有一个小开口，称为裂孔。用于吞咽食物的管道称为食道，在连接到胃之前穿过裂孔。在食管裂孔疝中，胃通过该开口向上推入胸部。小的食管裂孔疝通常不会引起问题。您可能永远不知道自己患有这种疾病，除非您的医疗团队在检查另一种疾病时发现它。但是，大的食管裂孔疝可能会让食物和胃酸倒流到您的食道中。这可能会导致胃灼热。自我护理措施或药物通常可以缓解这些症状。非常大的食管裂孔疝可能需要手术。
desc_en: A hiatal hernia happens when the upper part of the stomach bulges through the large muscle that separates the abdomen and the chest. The muscle is called the diaphragm.The diaphragm has a small opening called a hiatus. The tube used for swallowing food, called the esophagus, passes through the hiatus before connecting to the stomach. In a hiatal hernia, the stomach pushes up through that opening and into the chest.A small hiatal hernia usually doesn't cause problems. You may never know you have one unless your healthcare team discovers it when checking for another condition.But a large hiatal hernia can allow food and acid to back up into your esophagus. This can cause heartburn. Self-care measures or medicines can usually relieve these symptoms. A very large hiatal hernia might need surgery.

title: 打嗝
desc: 打嗝是指膈肌反复痉挛或无法控制的突然运动。隔膜是将胸部与腹部区域分开的肌肉，在呼吸中起着重要作用。膈肌痉挛会导致声带突然闭合，发出“打嗝”的声音。吃大餐、喝酒精或碳酸饮料或突然兴奋都可能导致打嗝。在某些情况下，打嗝可能是潜在健康问题的征兆。对于大多数人来说，打嗝通常只持续几分钟。很少情况下，打嗝可能会持续数月。当它们持续那么久时，就会导致体重减轻和极度疲劳。
desc_en: Hiccups are repeated spasms or sudden movements of the diaphragm that you can't control. The diaphragm is the muscle that separates your chest from your stomach area and plays an important role in breathing. A spasm in your diaphragm causes your vocal cords to suddenly close, producing a "hic" sound.Eating a large meal, drinking alcoholic or carbonated beverages, or getting excited suddenly may cause hiccups. In some cases, hiccups may be a sign of an underlying medical issue. For most people, hiccups usually last only a few minutes. Rarely, hiccups may continue for months. When they last that long, they can result in weight loss and extreme tiredness.

title: 化脓性汗腺炎
desc: 化脓性汗腺炎（hi-drad-uh-NIE-tis su-yoo-ruh-TIE-vuh），也称为反痤疮，是一种导致皮下形成小而疼痛的肿块的疾病。肿块通常出现在皮肤相互摩擦的部位，例如腋窝、腹股沟、臀部和乳房。肿块愈合缓慢，容易复发，并可能导致皮下隧道和疤痕。化脓性汗腺炎往往在青春期后开始，通常在 40 岁之前。它可以持续多年，并随着时间的推移而恶化。它会影响您的日常生活和情绪健康。药物和手术相结合的治疗可以帮助控制疾病并预防并发症。女性患化脓性汗腺炎的可能性是女性的三倍，尽管这个比例在世界各地可能有所不同。此外，黑人比其他种族的人更容易患这种疾病。这可能归因于遗传因素。
desc_en: Hidradenitis suppurativa (hi-drad-uh-NIE-tis sup-yoo-ruh-TIE-vuh), also known as acne inversa, is a condition that causes small, painful lumps to form under the skin. The lumps usually develop in areas where your skin rubs together, such as the armpits, groin, buttocks and breasts. The lumps heal slowly, recur, and can lead to tunnels under the skin and scarring.Hidradenitis suppurativa tends to start after puberty, usually before age 40. It can persist for many years and worsen over time. It can affect your daily life and emotional well-being. Combined medical and surgical therapy can help manage the disease and prevent complications.Women are three times more likely to develop hidradenitis suppurativa, though this ratio can differ by location around the world. Also, Black people are more likely to develop this disease than people of other races. This could be attributed to genetic factors.

title: 髋关节发育不良
desc: 髋关节发育不良是一个医学术语，指的是髋关节窝未完全覆盖大腿骨上部的球形部分。这使得髋关节部分或完全脱位。大多数患有髋关节发育不良的人生来就有这种情况。医生会在您的宝宝出生后不久和在婴儿健康检查期间检查是否有髋关节发育不良的迹象。如果在婴儿早期诊断出髋关节发育不良，软支架通常可以纠正问题。较轻的髋关节发育不良病例可能直到青少年或年轻人才开始引起症状。髋关节发育不良会损伤关节内的软骨，还会损伤髋关节窝部周围的软软骨（盂唇）。这称为髋关节盂唇撕裂。对于年龄较大的儿童和年轻人，可能需要进行手术将骨头移动到正确的位置，以实现关节的平滑运动。
desc_en: Hip dysplasia is the medical term for a hip socket that doesn't fully cover the ball portion of the upper thighbone. This allows the hip joint to become partially or completely dislocated. Most people with hip dysplasia are born with the condition.Doctors will check your baby for signs of hip dysplasia shortly after birth and during well-baby visits. If hip dysplasia is diagnosed in early infancy, a soft brace can usually correct the problem.Milder cases of hip dysplasia might not start causing symptoms until a person is a teenager or young adult. Hip dysplasia can damage the cartilage lining the joint, and it can also hurt the soft cartilage (labrum) that rims the socket portion of the hip joint. This is called a hip labral tear.In older children and young adults, surgery may be needed to move the bones into the proper positions for smooth joint movement.

title: 荨麻疹和血管性水肿
desc: 荨麻疹 - 也称为荨麻疹 (ur-tih-KAR-e-uh) - 是一种皮肤反应，会引起发痒的伤痕，其大小从小斑点到大斑点不等。荨麻疹可由多种情况和物质引发，包括某些食物和药物。血管性水肿可能与荨麻疹一起出现，也可能单独出现。它会导致深层皮肤肿胀，通常是面部和嘴唇周围。短暂（急性）荨麻疹和血管性水肿很常见。大多数时候，它们是无害的，一天之内就会消失，即使不进行治疗也不会留下任何持久的痕迹。持续超过六周的荨麻疹称为慢性荨麻疹。荨麻疹和血管性水肿通常用抗组胺药物治疗。如果舌头或喉咙肿胀阻塞气道，血管性水肿可能会危及生命。
desc_en: Hives — also known as urticaria (ur-tih-KAR-e-uh) — is a skin reaction that causes itchy welts that range in size from small spots to large blotches. Hives can be triggered by many situations and substances, including certain foods and medications.Angioedema can arise with hives or alone. It causes swelling in the deeper layers of skin, often around the face and lips. Short-lived (acute) hives and angioedema are common. Most times, they are harmless, clear up within in a day and don't leave any lasting marks, even without treatment. Hives that last longer than six weeks are called chronic hives.Hives and angioedema are usually treated with antihistamine medication. Angioedema can be life-threatening if swelling of the tongue or in the throat blocks the airway.

title: 囤积症
desc: 囤积症是指因认为自己需要保存财物而持续难以扔掉或放弃财物。一想到要扔掉这些物品，您可能会感到痛苦。你逐渐保留或收集了大量的物品，不管它们的实际价值如何。囤积往往会造成极其狭窄的生活条件，只有狭窄的通道蜿蜒穿过成堆的杂物。台面、水槽、炉灶、桌子、楼梯和所有其他表面通常都堆满了东西。您可能无法将某些区域用于其预期目的。例如，您可能无法在厨房做饭。当您的家中没有更多空间时，杂乱可能会蔓延到车库、车辆、院子和其他存储区域。囤积的程度从轻微到严重不等。在某些情况下，囤积症可能不会对您的生活产生太大影响，而在其他情况下，它会严重影响您的日常功能。患有囤积症的人可能不认为这是一个问题，因此让他们参与治疗可能具有挑战性。但强化治疗可以帮助您了解如何改变您的信念和行为，从而让您过上更安全、更愉快的生活。
desc_en: Hoarding disorder is an ongoing difficulty throwing away or parting with possessions because you believe that you need to save them. You may experience distress at the thought of getting rid of the items. You gradually keep or gather a huge number of items, regardless of their actual value.Hoarding often creates extremely cramped living conditions with only narrow pathways winding through stacks of clutter. Countertops, sinks, stoves, desks, stairways and all other surfaces are usually piled with stuff. You may not be able to use some areas for their intended purpose. For example, you may not be able to cook in the kitchen. When there's no more room inside your home, the clutter may spread to the garage, vehicles, yard and other storage areas.Hoarding ranges from mild to severe. In some cases, hoarding may not have much impact on your life, while in other cases it seriously affects your daily functioning.People with hoarding disorder may not see it as a problem, so getting them to take part in treatment can be challenging. But intensive treatment can help you understand how your beliefs and behaviors can be changed so that you can live a safer, more enjoyable life.

title: 霍奇金淋巴瘤（霍奇金病）
desc: 霍奇金淋巴瘤是一种影响淋巴系统的癌症，淋巴系统是人体抗菌免疫系统的一部分。在霍奇金淋巴瘤中，称为淋巴细胞的白细胞生长失控，导致淋巴结肿胀和全身生长。霍奇金淋巴瘤以前称为霍奇金病，是淋巴瘤的两大类之一。另一种是非霍奇金淋巴瘤。霍奇金淋巴瘤诊断和治疗的进步帮助患有这种疾病的人有机会完全康复。霍奇金淋巴瘤患者的预后持续改善。
desc_en: Hodgkin's lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's germ-fighting immune system. In Hodgkin's lymphoma, white blood cells called lymphocytes grow out of control, causing swollen lymph nodes and growths throughout the body.Hodgkin's lymphoma, which used to be called Hodgkin's disease, is one of two general categories of lymphoma. The other is non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.Advances in diagnosis and treatment of Hodgkin's lymphoma have helped give people with this disease the chance for a full recovery. The prognosis continues to improve for people with Hodgkin's lymphoma.

title: 亨廷顿氏病
desc: 亨廷顿舞蹈症是一种罕见的遗传性疾病，会导致大脑神经细胞进行性破坏（退化）。亨廷顿舞蹈症对人的功能能力有广泛的影响，通常会导致运动、思维（认知）和精神障碍。亨廷顿舞蹈病的症状可以随时出现，但通常在人们 30 多岁或 40 多岁时首次出现。如果这种情况在 20 岁之前出现，则称为青少年亨廷顿舞蹈症。当亨廷顿舞蹈病早期出现时，症状会有所不同，并且疾病进展可能会更快。可以使用药物来帮助控制亨廷顿舞蹈病的症状。但治疗无法阻止与该病症相关的身体、精神和行为衰退。
desc_en: Huntington's disease is a rare, inherited disease that causes the progressive breakdown (degeneration) of nerve cells in the brain. Huntington's disease has a wide impact on a person's functional abilities and usually results in movement, thinking (cognitive) and psychiatric disorders.Huntington's disease symptoms can develop at any time, but they often first appear when people are in their 30s or 40s. If the condition develops before age 20, it's called juvenile Huntington's disease. When Huntington's develops early, symptoms are somewhat different and the disease may progress faster.Medications are available to help manage the symptoms of Huntington's disease. But treatments can't prevent the physical, mental and behavioral decline associated with the condition.

title: 鞘膜积液
desc: 鞘膜积液 (HI-droe-seel) 是阴囊（容纳睾丸的皮肤袋）的一种肿胀。当液体聚集在睾丸周围的薄囊中时，就会发生这种肿胀。鞘膜积液在新生儿中很常见。鞘膜积液通常会在 1 岁时不经治疗而自行消失。年龄较大的儿童和成人可能会因阴囊内受伤或其他健康问题而患上鞘膜积液。鞘膜积液通常不会引起疼痛或有害。可能不需要任何治疗。但如果阴囊看起来肿胀，去看医生很重要。
desc_en: A hydrocele (HI-droe-seel) is a type of swelling in the scrotum, the pouch of skin that holds the testicles. This swelling happens when fluid collects in the thin sac that surrounds a testicle. Hydroceles are common in newborns. They often go away without treatment by age 1. Older children and adults can get a hydrocele due to an injury within the scrotum or other health problems.A hydrocele often isn't painful or harmful. It might not need any treatment. But it's important to see a health care provider if the scrotum looks swollen.

title: 脑积水
desc: 脑积水是大脑深处称为脑室的空腔中液体的积聚。多余的液体会增加脑室的大小并对大脑施加压力。脑脊液通常流过脑室并冲洗大脑和脊柱。但过多的脑脊液压力会损害脑组织，并引起一系列与脑功能相关的症状。脑积水可以发生在任何年龄，但更常见于婴儿和60岁及以上的成年人。手术可以恢复并维持大脑中健康的脑脊液水平。治疗可以控制脑积水引起的症状。
type: Cerebrospinal Fluid Dynamics Clinic in Florida
desc_en: Hydrocephalus is the buildup of fluid in cavities called ventricles deep within the brain. The excess fluid increases the size of the ventricles and puts pressure on the brain.Cerebrospinal fluid usually flows through the ventricles and bathes the brain and spinal column. But the pressure of too much cerebrospinal fluid can damage brain tissues and cause a range of symptoms related to brain function.Hydrocephalus can happen at any age, but it occurs more often among infants and among adults 60 and older. Surgery can restore and maintain healthy cerebrospinal fluid levels in the brain. Therapies can manage symptoms resulting from hydrocephalus.

title: 高钙血症
desc: 高钙血症是一种血液中钙含量高于正常水平的疾病。血液中过多的钙会削弱您的骨骼，形成肾结石，并干扰您的心脏和大脑的工作。高钙血症通常是甲状旁腺过度活跃的结果。这四个小腺体位于颈部，靠近甲状腺。高钙血症的其他原因包括癌症、某些其他疾病、某些药物以及服用过多的钙和维生素 D 补充剂。高钙血症的体征和症状从不存在到严重不等。治疗取决于病因。
desc_en: Hypercalcemia is a condition in which the calcium level in your blood is above normal. Too much calcium in your blood can weaken your bones, create kidney stones, and interfere with how your heart and brain work.Hypercalcemia is usually a result of overactive parathyroid glands. These four tiny glands are situated in the neck, near the thyroid gland. Other causes of hypercalcemia include cancer, certain other medical disorders, some medications, and taking too much of calcium and vitamin D supplements.Signs and symptoms of hypercalcemia range from nonexistent to severe. Treatment depends on the cause.

title: 嗜酸性粒细胞增多综合征
desc: 嗜酸性粒细胞增多 (hy-per-ee-o-SIN-o-phil-ik) 综合征 (HES) 是一组血液疾病，当您的嗜酸性粒细胞（在免疫系统中发挥重要作用的白细胞）数量过多时就会发生。随着时间的推移，过量的嗜酸性粒细胞进入各种组织，最终损害您的器官。最常见的目标是皮肤、肺、消化道、心脏、血液和神经系统。如果不进行治疗，HES 可能会危及生命。
desc_en: Hypereosinophilic (hy-per-ee-o-SIN-o-phil-ik) syndrome (HES) is a group of blood disorders that occur when you have high numbers of eosinophils — white blood cells that play an important role in your immune system. Over time, the excess eosinophils enter various tissues, eventually damaging your organs.The most common targets are the skin, lungs, digestive tract, heart, blood and nervous system. Untreated, HES can become life-threatening.

title: 多汗症
desc: 多汗症 (hi-pur-hi-DROE-sis) 是指出汗过多，并不总是与高温或运动有关。您可能会出很多汗，以致汗水浸透衣服或从手上滴下来。大量出汗会扰乱您的一天并导致社交焦虑和尴尬。多汗症治疗通常会有所帮助。通常从止汗剂开始。如果这些没有帮助，您可能需要尝试不同的药物和疗法。在严重的情况下，您的医疗保健提供者可能会建议手术切除汗腺或断开与产生过多汗液相关的神经。有时可能会发现并治疗潜在的病症。
desc_en: Hyperhidrosis (hi-pur-hi-DROE-sis) is excessive sweating that's not always related to heat or exercise. You may sweat so much that it soaks through your clothes or drips off your hands. Heavy sweating can disrupt your day and cause social anxiety and embarrassment.Hyperhidrosis treatment usually helps. It often begins with antiperspirants. If these don't help, you may need to try different medications and therapies. In severe cases, your health care provider may suggest surgery to remove the sweat glands or to disconnect the nerves related to producing too much sweat.Sometimes an underlying condition may be found and treated.

title: 高草酸尿症和草酸中毒
desc: 当尿液中草酸过多时，就会发生高草酸尿症 (hi-pur-ok-suh-LU-ree-uh)。草酸盐是人体产生的一种天然化学物质。它也存在于一些食物中。但尿液中草酸过多会导致严重问题。高草酸尿症可能是由基因变化、肠道疾病或食用过多草酸含量高的食物引起的。肾脏的长期健康取决于及早发现高草酸尿症并迅速治疗。对于患有原发性和肠道相关原因的高草酸尿症的人来说，肾脏停止正常工作后，就会发生草酸中毒 (ok-suh-LOW-sis)。血液中积聚了过多的草酸。这会导致血管、骨骼和器官中草酸盐积聚。
desc_en: Hyperoxaluria (hi-pur-ok-suh-LU-ree-uh) happens when you have too much oxalate in your urine. Oxalate is a natural chemical the body makes. It's also found in some foods. But too much oxalate in the urine can cause serious problems.Hyperoxaluria can be caused by a change in a gene, an intestine disease or eating too many foods that are high in oxalate. The long-term health of your kidneys depends on finding hyperoxaluria early and getting it treated quickly.Oxalosis (ok-suh-LOW-sis) happens after the kidneys stop working well in people who have primary and intestine-related causes of hyperoxaluria. Too much oxalate collects in the blood. This can lead to oxalate buildups in blood vessels, bones and organs.

title: 甲状腺功能亢进症（甲状腺功能亢进）
desc: 当甲状腺产生过多的甲状腺激素时，就会发生甲状腺功能亢进症。这种情况也称为甲状腺功能亢进。甲状腺机能亢进会加速身体的新陈代谢。这可能会导致许多症状，例如体重减轻、手颤抖以及心跳加快或不规则。甲状腺功能亢进有多种治疗方法。抗甲状腺药物和放射性碘可用于减缓甲状腺产生的激素量。有时，甲状腺功能亢进症的治疗包括手术切除全部或部分甲状腺。在某些情况下，根据病因，甲状腺功能亢进症可能会在不服用药物或其他治疗的情况下得到改善。
desc_en: Hyperthyroidism happens when the thyroid gland makes too much thyroid hormone. This condition also is called overactive thyroid. Hyperthyroidism speeds up the body's metabolism. That can cause many symptoms, such as weight loss, hand tremors, and rapid or irregular heartbeat.Several treatments are available for hyperthyroidism. Anti-thyroid medicines and radioiodine can be used to slow the amount of hormones the thyroid gland makes. Sometimes, hyperthyroidism treatment includes surgery to remove all or part of the thyroid gland. In some cases, depending on what's causing it, hyperthyroidism may improve without medication or other treatment.

title: 肥厚型心肌病
desc: 肥厚型心肌病 (HCM) 是一种心肌增厚（肥大）的疾病。增厚的心肌会使心脏更难泵血。肥厚型心肌病常常未被诊断出来，因为许多患有这种疾病的人几乎没有任何症状。然而，在少数 HCM 患者中，增厚的心肌会导致呼吸短促、胸痛或心脏电系统的变化，从而导致危及生命的心律不齐（心律失常）或猝死。
desc_en: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is a disease in which the heart muscle becomes thickened (hypertrophied). The thickened heart muscle can make it harder for the heart to pump blood.Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy often goes undiagnosed because many people with the disease have few, if any, symptoms. However, in a small number of people with  HCM, the thickened heart muscle can cause shortness of breath, chest pain or changes in the heart's electrical system, resulting in life-threatening irregular heart rhythms (arrhythmias) or sudden death.

title: 低钠血症
desc: 当血液中的钠浓度异常低时，就会发生低钠血症。钠是一种电解质，它有助于调节细胞内和细胞周围的水量。在低钠血症中，一个或多个因素（从潜在的健康状况到喝太多水）会导致体内的钠被稀释。当这种情况发生时，你体内的水位会上升，你的细胞开始肿胀。这种肿胀会导致许多健康问题，从轻微到危及生命。低钠血症治疗的目的是解决潜在的病症。根据低钠血症的原因，您可能只需要减少饮酒量。在其他低钠血症的情况下，您可能需要静脉注射电解质溶液和药物。
desc_en: Hyponatremia occurs when the concentration of sodium in your blood is abnormally low. Sodium is an electrolyte, and it helps regulate the amount of water that's in and around your cells.In hyponatremia, one or more factors — ranging from an underlying medical condition to drinking too much water — cause the sodium in your body to become diluted. When this happens, your body's water levels rise, and your cells begin to swell. This swelling can cause many health problems, from mild to life-threatening.Hyponatremia treatment is aimed at resolving the underlying condition. Depending on the cause of hyponatremia, you may simply need to cut back on how much you drink. In other cases of hyponatremia, you may need intravenous electrolyte solutions and medications.

title: 垂体机能减退症
desc: 垂体机能减退症是一种罕见的疾病，垂体不能产生一种或多种激素，或者不能产生足够的激素。垂体是位于大脑底部的芸豆大小的腺体。它是身体产生激素的腺体系统的一部分，称为内分泌系统。脑下垂体产生多种激素。它们几乎作用于身体的每个部位。垂体功能减退症是指一种或多种垂体激素不足的情况。这种激素缺乏（称为缺乏症）会以多种方式影响身体的运作方式。其中包括生长、血压和生育能力等。症状取决于缺少哪种激素。垂体机能减退症患者通常需要终生服药。这些药物替代了缺失的激素，有助于控制症状。
desc_en: Hypopituitarism is a rare condition in which the pituitary gland doesn't make one or more hormones or doesn't make enough hormones.The pituitary gland is a kidney-bean-sized gland at the base of your brain. It is part of the body's system of glands that make hormones, called the endocrine system. The pituitary gland makes several hormones. They act on nearly every part of the body.Hypopituitarism is when there isn't enough of one or more of the pituitary hormones. This lack of hormones, called a deficiency, can affect how the body works in many ways. These include growth, blood pressure and the ability to have children, among others. Symptoms depend on which hormones are missing.People who have hypopituitarism usually need to take medicines for the rest of their lives. These medicines replace the missing hormones, which helps control symptoms.

title: 尿道下裂
desc: 尿道下裂 (hi-poe-SPAY-dee-us) 是一种出生缺陷（先天性疾病），尿道开口位于阴茎下侧而不是尖端。尿道是尿液从膀胱排出并排出体外的管道。尿道下裂很常见，不会给护理婴儿带来困难。手术通常可以恢复孩子阴茎的正常外观。通过成功治疗尿道下裂，大多数男性可以正常排尿和生殖。
desc_en: Hypospadias (hi-poe-SPAY-dee-us) is a birth defect (congenital condition) in which the opening of the urethra is on the underside of the penis instead of at the tip. The urethra is the tube through which urine drains from your bladder and exits your body.Hypospadias is common and doesn't cause difficulty in caring for your infant. Surgery usually restores the normal appearance of your child's penis. With successful treatment of hypospadias, most males can have normal urination and reproduction.

title: 甲状腺功能减退症（甲状腺功能低下）
desc: 体温过低是一种医疗紧急情况，当您的身体失去热量的速度快于产生热量的速度时就会发生，从而导致危险的低体温。正常体温约为 98.6 F (37 C)。当您的体温低于 95 F (35 C) 时，就会发生体温过低 (hi-poe-THUR-me-uh)。当您的体温下降时，您的心脏、神经系统和其他器官将无法正常工作。如果不及时治疗，体温过低会导致心脏和呼吸系统完全衰竭，并最终导致死亡。体温过低通常是由于暴露在寒冷的天气或浸泡在冷水中引起的。体温过低的主要治疗方法是将身体加热至正常温度。
desc_en: Hypothermia is a medical emergency that occurs when your body loses heat faster than it can produce heat, causing a dangerously low body temperature. Normal body temperature is around 98.6 F (37 C). Hypothermia (hi-poe-THUR-me-uh) occurs as your body temperature falls below 95 F (35 C).When your body temperature drops, your heart, nervous system and other organs can't work normally. Left untreated, hypothermia can lead to complete failure of your heart and respiratory system and eventually to death.Hypothermia is often caused by exposure to cold weather or immersion in cold water. Primary treatments for hypothermia are methods to warm the body back to a normal temperature.

title: 特发性嗜睡症
desc: 特发性嗜睡症是一种罕见的睡眠障碍，即使经过一整夜的良好睡眠，也会导致您白天非常困倦。其原因尚不清楚。它还常常导致您睡着后难以醒来。如果您小睡，您通常不会感到精神焕发，醒来时可能会感到困惑和迷失方向。睡眠需求可能随时出现，包括当您开车或工作时，这使得特发性嗜睡症具有潜在的危险。这种情况往往是逐渐发展的。诊断特发性嗜睡症需要排除更常见的睡眠障碍。治疗的目的是通过药物控制症状。
desc_en: Idiopathic hypersomnia is an uncommon sleep disorder that causes you to be very sleepy during the day even after a full night of good sleep. Its cause is unknown. It also often causes difficulty waking up after you've been asleep. If you take a nap, you generally don't feel refreshed and you may wake up confused and disoriented.The need to sleep can strike at any time, including when you're driving a car or working, which makes idiopathic hypersomnia potentially dangerous.The condition often develops gradually. Diagnosing idiopathic hypersomnia requires ruling out more-common sleep disorders. The aim of treatment is to control symptoms with medication.

title: IgA 肾病（伯杰病）
desc: IgA 肾病（nuh-FROP-uh-thee），也称为伯杰病，是一种肾脏疾病。当一种称为免疫球蛋白 A (IgA) 的抗菌蛋白在肾脏中积聚时，就会发生这种情况。这会导致一种称为炎症的肿胀，随着时间的推移，会使肾脏更难过滤血液中的废物。IgA 肾病往往会随着时间的推移慢慢恶化。但病程因人而异。有些人的尿液中渗血，但没有其他问题。其他人可能会出现并发症，例如丧失肾功能和蛋白质溢出到尿液中。还有一些人出现肾衰竭，这意味着肾脏无法正常工作，无法自行过滤体内废物。 IgA 肾病无法治愈，但药物可以减缓病情恶化的速度。有些人需要治疗以减轻炎症、减少蛋白质溢出到尿液中并防止肾脏衰竭。此类治疗可能有助于疾病变得不活跃，这种状态称为缓解。控制血压和降低胆固醇也能减缓疾病。
desc_en: IgA nephropathy (nuh-FROP-uh-thee), also known as Berger disease, is a kidney disease. It happens when a germ-fighting protein called immunoglobulin A (IgA) builds up in the kidneys. This causes a type of swelling called inflammation that, over time, can make it harder for the kidneys to filter waste from the blood.IgA nephropathy often becomes worse slowly over years. But the course of the disease varies from person to person. Some people leak blood into their urine without having other problems. Others might have complications such as losing kidney function and spilling protein into the urine. Still others develop kidney failure, which means the kidneys stop working well enough to filter the body's waste on their own.There's no cure for IgA nephropathy, but medicines can slow how quickly it becomes worse. Some people need treatment to lower inflammation, reduce the spilling of protein into the urine and prevent the kidneys from failing. Such treatments may help the disease become not active, a state called remission. Keeping blood pressure under control and lowering cholesterol also slow the disease.

title: 免疫性血小板减少症（ITP）
desc: 免疫性血小板减少症 (ITP) 是一种可能导致瘀伤和出血的疾病。帮助凝血的细胞（也称为血小板）水平低，最常导致出血。ITP 曾被称为特发性血小板减少性紫癜，可导致紫色瘀伤。它还会导致皮肤上出现微小的红紫色斑点，看起来像皮疹。儿童感染病毒后可能会感染 ITP。他们通常无需治疗即可好转。对于成人，这种疾病通常持续数月或数年。没有出血且血小板计数不太低的 ITP 患者可能不需要治疗。对于更严重的症状，治疗可能包括使用提高血小板计数的药物或切除脾脏的手术。
desc_en: Immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) is an illness that can lead to bruising and bleeding. Low levels of the cells that help blood clot, also known as platelets, most often cause the bleeding.Once known as idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, ITP can cause purple bruises. It also can cause tiny reddish-purple dots on the skin that look like a rash.Children can get ITP after a virus. They most often get better without treatment. In adults, the illness often lasts months or years.People with ITP who aren't bleeding and whose platelet count isn't too low might not need treatment. For worse symptoms, treatment might include medicines to raise platelet count or surgery to remove the spleen.

title: 阻生智齿
desc: 智齿是口腔后部的第三颗臼齿，是最后长出的恒牙。大多数人有四颗智齿——两颗在顶部，两颗在底部。当智齿受到阻生时，它们没有足够的空间以通常的方式萌出或发育。阻生智齿会引起疼痛、损坏其他牙齿并导致其他牙齿问题。有时它们不会造成任何问题。但由于智齿难以清洁，它们可能比其他牙齿更容易出现蛀牙和牙龈疾病。导致疼痛或其他牙齿问题的阻生智齿通常会被拔除。一些牙医和口腔外科医生还建议拔除不会引起症状的阻生智齿，以防止未来出现问题。
desc_en: Wisdom teeth, the third molars at the back of the mouth, are the last adult teeth to come in. Most people have four wisdom teeth — two on the top and two on the bottom. When wisdom teeth become impacted, they don't have enough room to emerge or develop in the usual way.Impacted wisdom teeth can cause pain, damage other teeth and lead to other dental problems. Sometimes they don't cause any problems. But because wisdom teeth are hard to clean, they may be more prone to tooth decay and gum disease than other teeth.Impacted wisdom teeth that cause pain or other dental problems usually are taken out. Some dentists and oral surgeons also recommend taking out impacted wisdom teeth that don't cause symptoms to prevent future problems.

title: 子宫颈机能不全
desc: 当宫颈组织薄弱导致或导致早产或健康妊娠失败时，就会出现宫颈机能不全。子宫颈机能不全也称为宫颈机能不全。子宫颈是子宫通向阴道的下部。怀孕前，子宫通常是闭合且坚硬的。随着怀孕的进行和您准备分娩，子宫颈会慢慢发生变化。它变软、变短并打开。如果您的子宫颈机能不全，它可能会过早打开，导致您过早分娩。子宫颈机能不全可能是一个很难诊断和治疗的问题。如果您的子宫颈开始提前打开，或者您过去曾患有子宫颈机能不全，那么您可能会从治疗中受益。这可能包括用强力缝合线闭合子宫颈的手术，称为宫颈环扎术。您还可以服用药物来帮助改善子宫颈机能不全，并进行超声波检查来检查情况。
desc_en: An incompetent cervix happens when weak cervical tissue causes or plays a part in a premature birth or the loss of a healthy pregnancy. An incompetent cervix also is called cervical insufficiency.The cervix is the lower part of the uterus that opens to the vagina. Before pregnancy, it's usually closed and firm. As pregnancy goes on and you get ready to give birth, the cervix slowly changes. It softens, gets shorter and opens. If you have an incompetent cervix, it might begin to open too soon causing you to give birth too early.An incompetent cervix can be a hard problem to diagnose and treat. If your cervix begins to open early, or if you've had cervical insufficiency in the past, you might benefit from treatment. This might include having a procedure done to close the cervix with strong sutures, called a cervical cerclage. You also may take medicine to help the incompetent cervix and have ultrasound exams to check how things are going.

title: 不孕症
desc: 如果您和您的伴侣正在努力生孩子，那么您并不孤单。世界各地数百万人面临着同样的挑战。不孕症是一个医学术语，指的是大多数夫妇在至少一年的频繁、无保护性行为的情况下仍无法怀孕。不孕可能是由于您或您的伴侣的健康问题，或多种阻碍怀孕的因素造成的。但许多安全有效的治疗方法可以增加您怀孕的机会。
type: Reproductive endocrinology and infertility in Minnesota
desc_en: If you and your partner are struggling to have a baby, you're not alone. Millions of people around the world face the same challenge. Infertility is the medical term for when you can't get pregnant despite having frequent, unprotected sex for at least a year for most couples. Infertility may happen because of a health issue with either you or your partner, or a mix of factors that prevent pregnancy. But many safe and effective treatments can boost your chances of getting pregnant.

title: 炎性乳腺癌
desc: 炎症性乳腺癌是一种罕见的乳腺癌，发展迅速，使受影响的乳房发红、肿胀和触痛。当癌细胞阻塞覆盖乳房的皮肤中的淋巴管，导致乳房出现特有的红肿外观时，就会发生炎症性乳腺癌。乳腺癌。炎性乳腺癌被认为是一种局部晚期癌症，这意味着它已经从原发点扩散到附近的组织，甚至可能扩散到附近的淋巴结。炎性乳腺癌很容易与乳房感染相混淆，后者是一种更常见的原因。乳房发红和肿胀。如果您发现乳房皮肤发生变化，请立即就医。
desc_en: Inflammatory breast cancer is a rare type of breast cancer that develops rapidly, making the affected breast red, swollen and tender.Inflammatory breast cancer occurs when cancer cells block the lymphatic vessels in skin covering the breast, causing the characteristic red, swollen appearance of the breast.Inflammatory breast cancer is considered a locally advanced cancer — meaning it has spread from its point of origin to nearby tissue and possibly to nearby lymph nodes.Inflammatory breast cancer can easily be confused with a breast infection, which is a much more common cause of breast redness and swelling. Seek medical attention promptly if you notice skin changes on your breast.

title: 毛发向内生长
desc: 当被去除的毛发开始重新生长并弯曲到皮肤中时，就会发生内生毛发。剃毛、镊子或打蜡可能会导致这种情况发生。向内生长的毛发会导致皮肤出现微小肿胀的肿块，可能会造成伤害。这种情况最常影响剃须的卷发黑人。大多数向内生长的毛发无需治疗即可好转。您可以通过不脱毛或不靠近皮肤剃毛来避免这种情况。如果这不是一个选择，您可以尝试其他脱毛方法，以减少毛发向内生长的风险。
desc_en: Ingrown hair occurs when a hair that's been removed starts to grow back and curves into the skin. Shaving, tweezing or waxing can cause this to happen. An ingrown hair can cause tiny, swollen bumps on the skin that may hurt. The condition most often affects Black people with curly hair who shave.Most instances of ingrown hair get better without treatment. You can avoid this condition by not removing hair or not shaving very close to the skin. If that's not an option, you might try other hair removal methods that lessen the risk of developing ingrown hair.

title: 遗传性代谢紊乱
desc: 遗传性代谢紊乱是由影响新陈代谢的特定基因变化引起的疾病。不同的基因变化会导致不同类型的遗传性代谢紊乱。这些基因变化最常见的是从父母双方遗传下来的。但有时基因变化仅来自父母之一，最常见的是来自母亲。这些疾病也称为先天性代谢缺陷。新陈代谢是您的身体用来维持生命的一组复杂的化学反应。其中包括：当这些过程不能正常工作时，就会发生代谢紊乱。这可能是由于酶太低或缺失或其他问题造成的。遗传性代谢紊乱分为不同的组。它们根据受影响的物质以及是否因无法分解而积累过多、是否含量太低或缺失进行分组。
desc_en: Inherited metabolic disorders are medical conditions caused by changes in specific genes that affect metabolism. Different gene changes cause different types of inherited metabolic disorders. These gene changes are most commonly passed down from both parents. But sometimes the gene change comes only from one parent, most often from the mother. These disorders also are called inborn errors of metabolism.Metabolism is the complex set of chemical reactions that your body uses to maintain life. These include:When these processes don't work properly, a metabolic disorder occurs. It may be due to an enzyme that's too low or missing or to another problem. Inherited metabolic disorders fall into different groups. They're grouped by the substance affected and whether it builds up too much because it can't be broken down or it's too low or missing.

title: 失眠
desc: 失眠是一种常见的睡眠障碍，会导致难以入睡或保持睡眠状态。它还可能导致您醒得太早并且无法重新入睡。当你醒来时，你可能仍然感到疲倦。失眠会耗尽你的精力并影响你的情绪。它还会影响您的健康、工作表现和生活质量。睡眠时间充足因人而异。但大多数成年人每晚需要7到9个小时。在某些时候，许多成年人会出现短暂的失眠。这可能会持续数天或数周。短期失眠通常是由于压力或令人痛苦的事件造成的。但有些人会出现长期失眠，也称为慢性失眠。这种情况持续三个月或更长时间。失眠可能是主要问题，也可能与其他医疗状况或药物有关。您不必忍受不眠之夜。简单改变你的日常习惯通常会有所帮助。
desc_en: Insomnia is a common sleep disorder that can make it hard to fall asleep or stay asleep. It also can cause you to wake up too early and not be able to get back to sleep. You may still feel tired when you wake up. Insomnia can drain your energy level and affect your mood. It also can affect your health, work performance and quality of life.How much sleep is enough varies from person to person. But most adults need 7 to 9 hours a night.At some point, many adults have short-term insomnia. This can last for days or weeks. Short-term insomnia is usually due to stress or a distressing event. But some people have long-term insomnia, also called chronic insomnia. This lasts for three months or more. Insomnia may be the main problem, or it may be related to other medical conditions or medicines.You do not have to put up with sleepless nights. Simple changes in your daily habits often can help.

title: 间歇性爆发性障碍
desc: 间歇性爆发性障碍包括反复、突然的冲动、攻击性、暴力行为或愤怒的言语爆发。对于目前的情况来说，反应过于极端。路怒症、家庭暴力、投掷或破坏物体或其他脾气可能是间歇性爆发性障碍的症状。这些断断续续的爆发性爆发会造成严重的痛苦。它们可能会损害人际关系并在工作或学校中造成问题。它们还可能导致法律问题。间歇性爆发性障碍是一种长期病症，可能持续数年。但爆发的严重程度可能会随着年龄的增长而减轻。治疗包括谈话疗法和药物来帮助您控制攻击性冲动。
desc_en: Intermittent explosive disorder involves repeated, sudden bouts of impulsive, aggressive, violent behavior or angry verbal outbursts. The reactions are too extreme for the situation. Road rage, domestic abuse, throwing or breaking objects, or other temper tantrums may be symptoms of intermittent explosive disorder.These explosive outbursts, which occur off and on, cause major distress. They can harm relationships and cause problems at work or school. They also can result in problems with the law.Intermittent explosive disorder is a long-term condition that can go on for years. But the severity of outbursts may lessen with age. Treatment involves talk therapy and medicine to help you control your aggressive impulses.

title: 间质性肺疾病
desc: 间质性 (in-tur-STISH-ul) 肺病描述了一大类疾病，其中大多数会导致肺组织进行性疤痕形成。与间质性肺病相关的疤痕最终会影响您的呼吸能力和将足够的氧气输送到血液中的能力。间质性肺病可能是由于长期接触石棉等有害物质引起的。某些类型的自身免疫性疾病，例如类风湿性关节炎，也可引起间质性肺疾病。然而，在某些情况下，原因仍不清楚。肺部疤痕一旦发生，通常是不可逆转的。药物可能会减缓间质性肺疾病的损害，但许多人永远无法恢复充分利用肺部。对于一些患有间质性肺病的人来说，肺移植是一种选择。梅奥诊所的间质性肺病护理
desc_en: Interstitial (in-tur-STISH-ul) lung disease describes a large group of disorders, most of which cause progressive scarring of lung tissue. The scarring associated with interstitial lung disease eventually affects your ability to breathe and get enough oxygen into your bloodstream.Interstitial lung disease can be caused by long-term exposure to hazardous materials, such as asbestos. Some types of autoimmune diseases, such as rheumatoid arthritis, also can cause interstitial lung disease. In some cases, however, the causes remain unknown.Once lung scarring occurs, it's generally irreversible. Medications may slow the damage of interstitial lung disease, but many people never regain full use of their lungs. Lung transplant is an option for some people who have interstitial lung disease.Interstitial lung disease care at Major Clinics

title: 浸润性小叶癌
desc: 浸润性小叶癌是一种乳腺癌，始于乳腺的产奶腺（小叶）。浸润性癌症是指癌细胞已从其开始的小叶中突破出来，并有可能扩散到淋巴结和身体的其他部位。浸润性小叶癌仅占所有乳腺癌的一小部分。最常见的乳腺癌类型始于乳腺导管（浸润性导管癌）。
desc_en: Invasive lobular carcinoma is a type of breast cancer that begins in the milk-producing glands (lobules) of the breast.Invasive cancer means the cancer cells have broken out of the lobule where they began and have the potential to spread to the lymph nodes and other areas of the body.Invasive lobular carcinoma makes up a small portion of all breast cancers. The most common type of breast cancer begins in the breast ducts (invasive ductal carcinoma).

title: 缺血性结肠炎
desc: 当流向部分大肠的血流暂时减少时，就会发生缺血性结肠炎。大肠的这一部分称为结肠。这种血流量减少可能是由于供应结肠的血管变窄造成的。也可能是由于低血压引起的血流量减少。血流量减少无法为消化系统中的细胞提供足够的氧气。这可能会导致肠道受影响区域的组织损伤。结肠的任何部分都可能受到影响，但缺血性结肠炎最常引起腹部左侧疼痛。缺血性结肠炎可能会被误诊，因为它很容易混淆与其他消化问题。您可能需要药物来治疗缺血性结肠炎或预防感染。或者，如果您的结肠受损，您可能需要手术。然而，大多数情况下，缺血性结肠炎会自行愈合。
desc_en: Ischemic colitis occurs when blood flow to part of the large intestine is temporarily reduced. This segment of the large intestine is called the colon. This reduced blood flow may be caused by narrowing of the blood vessels supplying the colon. It also may be due to reduced blood flow caused by low blood pressure. The diminished blood flow doesn't provide enough oxygen for the cells in the digestive system. This can result in tissue damage to the affected area of the intestine.Any part of the colon can be affected, but ischemic colitis most commonly causes pain on the left side of the belly area.Ischemic colitis can be misdiagnosed because it can easily be confused with other digestive problems. You may need medicine to treat ischemic colitis or prevent infection. Or you may need surgery if your colon has been damaged. Most often, however, ischemic colitis heals on its own.

title: 颌骨肿瘤和囊肿
desc: 颌肿瘤和囊肿是相对罕见的生长或病变，发生在颌骨或口腔和面部的软组织中。颌肿瘤和囊肿（有时被称为牙源性或非牙源性，具体取决于其来源）的大小和严重程度可能有很大差异。这些生长物通常是非癌性的（良性），但它们可能具有侵袭性，并且会扩张、移位或破坏周围的骨骼、组织和牙齿。颌骨肿瘤和囊肿的治疗方案会有所不同，具体取决于生长物或病变的类型、阶段生长情况和您的症状。口腔、颌面和面部（口腔颌面）外科医生通常可以通过手术治疗颌骨肿瘤或囊肿，或者在某些情况下通过药物治疗或手术和药物治疗相结合。
desc_en: Jaw tumors and cysts are relatively rare growths or lesions that develop in the jawbone or the soft tissues in the mouth and face. Jaw tumors and cysts — sometimes referred to as odontogenic or nonodontogenic, depending on their origin — can vary greatly in size and severity. These growths are usually noncancerous (benign), but they can be aggressive and expand, displace or destroy the surrounding bone, tissue and teeth.Treatment options for jaw tumors and cysts vary, depending on the type of growth or lesion you have, the stage of growth, and your symptoms. Mouth, jaw and face (oral and maxillofacial) surgeons can treat your jaw tumor or cyst usually by surgery, or in some cases, by medical therapy or a combination of surgery and medical therapy.

title: 水母蜇伤
desc: 对于在海洋中游泳、涉水或潜水的人来说，水母蜇伤是相当常见的问题。水母拖出的长触手可以从数千个微小的带刺毒刺中注入毒液。大多数情况下，水母蜇伤会导致皮肤立即疼痛和发炎痕迹。有些蜇伤可能会导致更多的全身（系统）疾病。在极少数情况下，它们会危及生命。大多数水母蜇伤经过家庭治疗后几天或几周就会好转。严重反应可能需要紧急医疗护理。
desc_en: Jellyfish stings are fairly common problems for people swimming, wading or diving in oceans. The long tentacles trailing from the jellyfish can inject venom from thousands of microscopic barbed stingers.Most often jellyfish stings cause instant pain and inflamed marks on the skin. Some stings may cause more whole-body (systemic) illness. And in rare cases they're life-threatening.Most jellyfish stings get better over a few days or weeks with home treatment. Severe reactions likely need emergency medical care.

title: 时差反应障碍
desc: 时差反应，也称为时差反应障碍，是一种暂时性睡眠问题，可能会影响任何快速跨越多个时区的人。您的身体有自己的内部时钟，称为昼夜节律。它们向您的身体发出何时保持清醒、何时睡觉的信号。时差反应的发生是因为您身体的生物钟与原来的时区同步。它并未更改为您旅行所在地的时区。跨越的时区越多，时差反应的可能性就越大。时差反应会导致白天疲劳、身体不适、难以保持警觉和胃病。尽管症状是暂时的，但它们可能会影响您度假或出差期间的舒适度。但您可以采取措施来帮助预防或减轻时差的影响。
desc_en: Jet lag, also called jet lag disorder, is a temporary sleep problem that can affect anyone who quickly travels across several time zones.Your body has its own internal clock, called circadian rhythms. They signal to your body when to stay awake and when to sleep.Jet lag occurs because your body's internal clock is synced to your original time zone. It hasn't changed to the time zone of where you've traveled. The more time zones crossed, the more likely you are to experience jet lag.Jet lag can cause daytime fatigue, an unwell feeling, trouble staying alert and stomach problems. Although symptoms are temporary, they can affect your comfort while on vacation or during a business trip. But you can take steps to help prevent or lessen the effects of jet lag.

title: 幼年特发性关节炎
desc: 幼年特发性关节炎，以前称为幼年类风湿性关节炎，是16岁以下儿童最常见的关节炎类型。幼年特发性关节炎可引起持续性关节疼痛、肿胀和僵硬。有些儿童可能只出现几个月的症状，而另一些儿童则会出现多年的症状。某些类型的幼年特发性关节炎可能会导致严重的并发症，例如生长问题、关节损伤和眼部炎症。治疗重点是控制疼痛和炎症、改善功能和预防损伤。
type: Shoulder and Elbow Surgery in Rochester
desc_en: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis, formerly known as juvenile rheumatoid arthritis, is the most common type of arthritis in children under the age of 16.Juvenile idiopathic arthritis can cause persistent joint pain, swelling and stiffness. Some children may experience symptoms for only a few months, while others have symptoms for many years.Some types of juvenile idiopathic arthritis can cause serious complications, such as growth problems, joint damage and eye inflammation. Treatment focuses on controlling pain and inflammation, improving function, and preventing damage.

title: 川崎病
desc: 川崎病会导致将血液输送到全身的中小型血管壁肿胀，称为炎症。川崎病最常影响儿童的心脏动脉。这些动脉向心脏供应富氧血液。川崎病有时被称为粘膜皮肤淋巴结综合征。这是因为它还会导致称为淋巴结的腺体以及口腔、鼻子、眼睛和喉咙内的粘膜肿胀。患有川崎病的儿童可能会发高烧、手脚肿胀、皮肤脱皮、眼睛和舌头发红。但川崎病通常是可以治疗的。通过早期治疗，大多数儿童都会好转，并且不会出现长期问题。
desc_en: Kawasaki disease causes swelling, called inflammation, in the walls of small to medium-sized blood vessels that carry blood throughout the body. Kawasaki disease most often affects the heart arteries in children. Those arteries supply oxygen-rich blood to the heart.Kawasaki disease  is sometimes called mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome. That's because it also causes swelling in glands, called lymph nodes, and mucous membranes inside the mouth, nose, eyes and throat.Children with Kawasaki disease might have high fever, swollen hands and feet with skin peeling, and red eyes and tongue. But Kawasaki disease is often treatable. With early treatment, most children get better and have no long-lasting problems.

title: 角膜炎
desc: 角膜炎是角膜的炎症，角膜是眼睛前面覆盖瞳孔和虹膜的透明圆顶状组织。角膜炎可能与感染有关，也可能无关。非感染性角膜炎可能是由相对较轻的伤害引起的，例如佩戴隐形眼镜时间过长或眼内异物。传染性角膜炎可由细菌、病毒、真菌和寄生虫引起。如果您出现眼睛发红或其他角膜炎症状，请预约看眼科专家。如果及时关注，轻度至中度角膜炎病例通常可以得到有效治疗，而不会丧失视力。如果不及时治疗，或者感染严重，角膜炎可能会导致严重的并发症，可能永久性损害您的视力。
desc_en: Keratitis is an inflammation of the cornea — the clear, dome-shaped tissue on the front of your eye that covers the pupil and iris. Keratitis may or may not be associated with an infection. Noninfectious keratitis can be caused by a relatively minor injury, such as from wearing your contact lenses too long or getting a foreign body in the eye. Infectious keratitis can be caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi and parasites.If you have eye redness or other symptoms of keratitis, make an appointment to see an eye specialist. With prompt attention, mild to moderate cases of keratitis can usually be effectively treated without loss of vision. If left untreated, or if an infection is severe, keratitis can lead to serious complications that may permanently damage your vision.

title: 圆锥角膜
desc: 圆锥角膜 (ker-uh-toe-KOH-nus) 是一种眼部疾病，您的角膜（眼睛的透明圆顶形前部）变薄并逐渐向外凸出成圆锥形。圆锥形角膜会导致视力模糊视力，并可能导致对光和眩光敏感。圆锥角膜通常影响双眼。然而，它对一只眼睛的影响比另一只眼睛更大。它通常开始影响青少年到 30 岁之间的人。这种情况可能会缓慢发展 10 年或更长时间。在圆锥角膜的早期阶段，您也许可以通过佩戴眼镜或软性隐形眼镜来矫正视力问题。之后，您可能需要佩戴硬质透气隐形眼镜或其他类型的镜片，例如巩膜镜。如果您的病情恶化，您可能需要进行角膜移植。一种称为角膜胶原交联的手术可能有助于减缓或阻止圆锥角膜的进展，从而可能避免将来需要进行角膜移植。除了上述视力矫正选项之外，还可以提供这种治疗。
desc_en: Keratoconus (ker-uh-toe-KOH-nus) is an eye condition in which your cornea — the clear, dome-shaped front of your eye — gets thinner and gradually bulges outward into a cone shape.A cone-shaped cornea causes blurred vision and may cause sensitivity to light and glare. Keratoconus usually affects both eyes. However, it can affect one eye more than the other. It generally begins to affect people between the late teens and 30 years of age. The condition may progress slowly for 10 years or longer.In the early stages of keratoconus, you might be able to correct vision problems with glasses or soft contact lenses. Later, you may have to be fitted with rigid, gas permeable contact lenses or other types of lenses, such as scleral lenses. If your condition gets worse, you may need a cornea transplant.A procedure called corneal collagen cross-linking may help to slow or stop keratoconus from progressing, possibly preventing the need for a future cornea transplant. This treatment may be offered in addition to the vision correction options above.

title: 毛周角化症
desc: 毛周角化病 (ker-uh-TOE-sis pih-LAIR-is) 是一种无害的皮肤病，会导致干燥、粗糙的斑块和微小肿块，通常出现在上臂、大腿、脸颊或臀部。这些肿块通常不会痛或痒。毛周角化症通常被认为是一种常见的皮肤病。它无法治愈或预防。但您可以使用保湿霜和处方霜来治疗，以帮助改善皮肤外观。这种情况通常会在 30 岁时消失。
desc_en: Keratosis pilaris (ker-uh-TOE-sis pih-LAIR-is) is a harmless skin condition that causes dry, rough patches and tiny bumps, often on the upper arms, thighs, cheeks or buttocks.
